Description: Entirely estate grown, this combines 55% Pinot Noir and 45% Chardonnay into a complex and persistently bright, lively wine that lingers on the palate. Beautifully aromatic, it is silky smooth in feel, with flavors of wet stone and oyster shell alongside peach, strawberry, tangerine and a tease of ginger.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Domaine Carneros 2015 Le Rêve Brut Rosé Sparkling (Carneros)

Description: Disgorged in April 2020, this piercing traditional-method sekt spent roughly five years on its lees developing seductive, smoky nuances of brioche and toast. A blend of 79% Pinot Noir and 21% Pinot Meunier, it's a bracing, invigorating dry sip packed with lemon and tart raspberry flavors. Delicate bubbles and bracing acidity linger long on the finish. Delicious now but should gain earthier, delicately caramelized complexities through the next decade and longer.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Raumland 2014 Cuvée Katharina Brut Nature Sparkling (Germany)

Description: Exuberant notes of raspberry and cherry blossoms abound in this traditional-method Pinot Noir fermented in stainless steel and kept on its lees for three years. A blend of 2014 and 2015 vintages, it's a lavishly floral, fresh-fruited sparkler braced by a piercing line of acidity and cooling mineral undertones. At peak now through 2030 but it should hold longer as well.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Raumland NV Rosé Prestige Brut Sparkling (Germany)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This exciting new release is estate-grown, barrel-fermented and aged in neutral oak prior to bottling ahead of second fermentation. Part of the winery's Grower Series, it's a rich and creamy wine, lightly toasty with flavors of lemon, apple and white melon. The crisp acidity ensures a decade or more of life ahead.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Argyle 2016 Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This stunning traditional-method sparkling wine is made from 63% Pinot Noir, 25% Chardonnay and 12% Pinot Meunier. Rich aromas of Fino Sherry-dipped almonds, seared lemon and ripe yellow apple dazzle on the nose. The savory palate carries a salted, blanched almond note lifted by a squeeze of lemon and framed by a kiss of toast.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Damiani 2013 Brut Méthode Champenoise  (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Made entirely from Pinot Noir, this rich sparkler dazzles in aromas of Sherry-dipped almonds, lemon custard and toasted brioche. It's creamy, rounded and full in feel on the palate, with a deft mix of ripe lemon, nut and toast flavors that show tension and depth. A savory, salty note extends on the lingering finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Lenz 2005 Méthode Champenoise Cuvée Sparkling (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This blend of 75% Pinot Noir and 25% Pinot Meunier offers bright, well-defined aromas of lemon peel and yellow apple wrapped in a warm, toasted brioche accent. The palate boasts a persistent perlage and a delicate tension that elongates the tense citrus and apple finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2016 Blanc de Noirs Méthode Champenoise  (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: This is a deliciously savory, mouthwatering sparkling rosé made from Chardonnay, Pinot Noir and Pinot Meunier. Warm, toasty brioche and sea salt meld with red apple peel and white currant, with a creamy mousse guiding these flavors along to a long, saline-infused finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Sparkling Pointe 2017 Topaz Impérial Méthode Champenoise  (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: A pale copper color, with pretty fruit flavors of apple and melon. This is a clean and refreshing wine, lightly toasty, all Pinot Noir, though with flavors more reminiscent of a Chardonnay-based sparkling wine. This spent three years on the yeast and is labeled “First Disgorge.”                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Carlton Hill 2016 Extra Brut Blanc de Noir Sparkling (Yamhill-Carlton)

Appellation: Val de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: Grower Jérôme Choblet crafts this crisp, fresh and perfumed sparkling wine from vineyards in the Muscadet region. The local Melon de Bourgogne grape combines with Grolleau Gris and Chardonnay in a wine with white fruits, lightly creamy and fresh at the end. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine des Herbauges NV Luminescence Brut Sparkling (Val de Loire)

Appellation: Crémant de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: This producer just across the Loire from Angers has created a spicy and creamy blend from Chenin Blanc and Pineau d'Aunis. A light touch of honey accompanies the baked-apple fruit and crisp final acidity. Drink this attractive wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Bois-Brinçon 2018 Sparkling (Crémant de Loire)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: This is a savory, nutty Chardonnay-based sparkler that offers rich aromas and flavors of toasted almond, bread crust, seared lemon and baked apple lightly dusted in warm spices. It's gentle and creamy on the palate, with a salty, nutty finish. Drink soon for best enjoyment.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Bedell 2016 Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Aromas of pear, melon, grapefruit and white blossoms carry the nose of this sparkling blend. Foamy bubbles fill the palate with juicy flavors of orange and melon, resolving well on the finish with a hint of sweetness, but pleasingly so. It's easy to drink this party-friendly wine.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Weis 2019 Perle Sparkling (Finger Lakes)

Description: This brut is made from 52% Chardonnay and 48% Pinot Noir, with 41% barrel fermented. Inviting in tangerine, peach and oyster shell, it has tension and energy on offer, the crisp freshness deliciously vibrant from start to finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Schramsberg 2015 Piedra Libre Vineyards Brut Sparkling (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Given plenty of time to age and coalesce, this impressive sparkler combines 59% Pinot Noir with 33% Chardonnay and 8% Pinot Meunier. Together, they offer a complex, vibrant imprint of orange peel, red cherry, strawberry and stone, while the foundation is structured and lengthy.                      Virginie Boone
Name: J Vineyards & Winery 2015 Brut Rosé Sparkling (Russian River Valley)

Description: This is a blend of 55% Chardonnay and 45% Pinot Noir, slightly barrel fermented and given time in bottle to evolve. Dark-gold in color, it is nutty and tastes of Christmas spice, potpourri and peanut brittle, with the Mayer lemon and tangerine-flavored acidity high toned and a good contrast to the beginning hints of oxidation.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Schramsberg 2000 Brut Late Disgorged Sparkling (Carneros)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This sparkling wine is fun and full of finesse, with crisp layers of strawberry, peach and Meyer lemon. From the producer's own dry-farmed Olivet Grange Estate Vineyard, it is deliciously fresh and fruity, with complex undertones of almond, anise and earth.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Inman Family 2018 Brut Rosé Sparkling (Russian River Valley)

Description: Showing aromas of marzipan, brioche and graham cracker, this sparkling blend is made from 60% Pinot Noir and 40% Pinot Meunier and spent three years en tirage. Layered swirls of white peach, green apple and wet stone give it vibrancy and a length of fruity flavor and freshness, leading to a complete, nutmeg-tinged finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: J Vineyards & Winery 2016 Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Sonoma Coast)

Description: Clover Hill's range of bubbly demonstrates Tasmania's ability to make traditional method sparklers that give Champagne a run for its money. The Vintage 2014 Brut is honeycomb hued with a heady, floral perfume reminiscent of jasmine and backed by subtler butterscotch and baked apple notes. The palate is opulent in flavor and mousse but is restrained, dry and refreshing, with the floral and apple notes lingering long on the finish.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Clover Hill 2014 Vintage Brut Sparkling (Tasmania)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A lively mousse leads to a refined core of rich baked pear, fig and almond croissant. With five years en tirage, it offers depth alongside crisp underlying freshness, with a creamy, memorable finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: J Vineyards & Winery 2014 Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Russian River Valley)

Description: This is a nuanced bubbly that would make a versatile food wine, yet also goes down the hatch quite easily on its own. It smells like a raspberry-and-red currant tart, or crème brûlée with berry sorbet. In the mouth it's dry, fresh and delicate with vibrant spritz, silky fruit and a slight cocktail bitters bite to the finish.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Clover Hill 2015 Cuvée Exceptionelle Rosé Sparkling (Tasmania)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is made from 61% Chardonnay, 36% Pinot Noir and 3% Pinot Meunier. Given time to gel in bottle, it is light-gold in color, with a fervent mousse that leads to a weighty midpalate of texture and heft. Blood orange, green apple and a peanut brittle-like nuttiness mingle through a lengthy finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: J Vineyards & Winery 2012 Brut Late Disgorged Sparkling (Russian River Valley)

Description: Precise aromas of plum and raspberry meet with more reserved scents of wet cement and turned earth on the nose of this bottling, which features the art of actor Billy Zane. There is impressively rocky minerality on the palate, where wet cement flavors lead toward tart plum skin and warmer cherry elements.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Paradise Springs NV Pink Ash Sparkling (California)

Description: This golden-hued blanc de blancs offers a classic Champagne-like nose of apple muffin and toffee with a fine mousse and a touch of bitterness at the finish. A little lacking in depth and texture, it nevertheless offers fleshy fruit and plenty of class.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Clover Hill 2013 Cuvée Exceptionelle Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Tasmania)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From the very clean mousse emerges aromas of Meyer lemon, apple cider, pastry and lemongrass on the nose of this bottling. The flavor profile of the palate is unique, ranging from tart citrus and apple to warmer melon tones.                      Matt Kettmann
Designation: Brut Cuvée Old Vines Blanc de Blanc
Name: Wolff 2018 Brut Cuvée Old Vines Blanc de Blanc Sparkling (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Beautifully presented aromas of rose petal, Mandarin peel and chalk are both subtle and sleek on the nose of this bottling by Laura Roach. The palate runs from brisk strawberry- skin and citrus-pith flavors to intriguing touches of wet earth.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Loubud 2019 Cebada Vineyards Brut Rosé Sparkling (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: An aggressive and excited mousse lifts aromas of chalk, gardenia and tart apple on the nose of this bottling. The palate shows a wide range of complexity, from steely minerality and pepper-like spice to citrus-splashed melon and mango.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Sea Smoke 2015 Sea Spray Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Sta. Rita Hills)

Description: From Tasmania's best known bubbles brand, this ballerina pink-hued Vintage Rosé opens with delicate aromas of watermelon and red berries, underscored by floral, herbal nuances. That herbal edge can be seen on the finish, too, which is long and lingering. Dry and slippery, with soft but persistent bubbles, this is a quaffing sparkler with an easygoing nature but that has the complexity to pair happily with a variety of fresh, summery dishes.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Jansz 2015 Vintage Rosé Sparkling (Tasmania)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rich aromas of honey lead into brighter hints of grapefruit peel and sliced nectarine on the nose of this bottling from Spanish Springs Vineyard. A tiny perlage on the palate leads to a creamy mouthfeel, loaded with flavors of yellow apple and citrus.                      Matt Kettmann
Designation: Jules de Brut Blanc de Blanc
Name: Lightpost 2018 Jules de Brut Blanc de Blanc Sparkling (San Luis Obispo County)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This is an excellent, traditional-style dry rosé. It's light salmon in color, offers tempting doughy, toasty aromas and subtle ginger, peach and red-cherry flavors. An elegant, crisp texture completes the pretty picture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Goldeneye 2017 Brut Rose Sparkling (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Again from this producer, a one-of-a-kind wine in the state, this time a sparkling Malbec. It's cloudy in appearance, with aromas of brioche followed by bright, broad feeling citrus flavors that tingle the palate. It's outright delicious and fun to boot.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Savage Grace 2019 Petillant Naturel Dineen Vineyard Côt Sparkling (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A blend of 52% Chardonnay, 35% Pinot Noir and 13% Pinot Meunier, this brut has a lively mousse and fresh flavors of oyster shell, green apple and Meyer lemon. The bright structure is complemented by savory details, giving it a sophisticated edge.                      Virginie Boone
Name: J Vineyards & Winery 2014 Brut Sparkling (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Yeasty aromas of sourdough lead into brisker touches of nectarine and lemon peel on the nose of this bottling. The yeasty touch extends to the palate, where it picks up a grapefruit-peel edge and proves quite refreshing.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Goat Bubbles 2017 Blanc de Noirs Ampelos Vineyard Sparkling (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: The brilliant coral color and engaging fruity aromas of this light-bodied sparkler lead to a rich, rather soft palate of cherry and strawberry flavors soothed by an off-dry, frothy mouthfeel. It's simply delicious.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Aloria 2019 Rozzé Sparkling (Calaveras County)

Description: Made from a 50-50 mix of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, the latter sourced from Sangiacomo Vineyard, this Brut offers broodingly rich layers of peach and green apple that are complemented by heartier elements of baked lemon and marzipan.                      Virginie Boone
Name: MacRostie 2017 Brut Sparkling (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Hints of dried cherry and toasty bread show on the yeasty nose of this bottling. There's a zesty orange flavor to the palate, where baked plum and dough flavors also arise.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Goat Bubbles 2017 Solomon Hills Vineyard Rosé Sparkling (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a rare valley sparkler made of Aglianico (78%) and Nebbiolo. Colored as if it were a red wine, it brings notes of plum and herb. The flavors are sleek, bright and acidity-driven. It's equal parts intrigue and delivery.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Designation: Rosso Pétillant Natural Old Milton Vineyard
Name: Grosgrain 2019 Rosso Pétillant Natural Old Milton Vineyard Sparkling (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Spicy apple aromas meet with white flowers and lemon zest on the nose of this bottling, unique as a sparkling Roussanne. The palate shows dried apple flavors and a hint of metallic minerality, more smooth than zesty.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Kitá 2016 Šuqštay Camp 4 Vineyard Sparkling (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Very pale in color, with aromas bringing notes of strawberry and apple. Crisp, bright flavors follow. It offers plenty of appeal.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Alki NV Bubbly Rosé Sparkling (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a deep-red sparkling wine that backs rich but dry black-fruit flavors with a fine bead of bubbles and good acidity for a bracing effect on the palate. It makes a fun escape from the ordinary.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Aloria 2017 Shirazzy Sparkling (Calaveras County)

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This dry and refreshing wine made from Viognier and Albariño grapes offers pineapple, Pippin apple and light vanilla flavors on a nicely frothy texture. It is appealing, mouthfilling and fresh.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Aloria 2019 Divinity Sparkling (Calaveras County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fresh, clean aromas of apple and pear lead to a palate that carries a lot of sugar. There are good things happening, but it needs a bit more acidity to tie them all together.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Alki NV Sparkling (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Redwood Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This hazy looking and boisterously foamy wine is a member of the earthy, pét-nat crowd and contains no added sulfites. It offers cider-vinegar aromas and orange-zest and peach-skin flavors. There is plenty of acidity to wash down some barbecue or burritos.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Powicana Farm 2018 Pétillant Naturel Rosé Sparkling (Redwood Valley)

Description: Briny cider-like aromas include yeasty notes that make this smell powdery. Conversely, the palate on this no-dosage Chardonnay-Pinot Noir is citric and fairly sharp. On first take this foams up on the palate, then acidity takes over creating pop and freshness along with tart flavors of sea brine and citrus fruits.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Santa Ema NV Ema Extra Brut Método Champenoise  (Leyda Valley)

Description: Made with 70% Pinot Nero and 30% Chardonnay, this exquisite, structured sparkler opens with enticing scents of rose petal, citrus, baking spice and red berry. The gorgeous, radiant palate boasts vibrancy and depth, featuring juicy red cherry and pomegranate overlaying rhubarb and mineral notes that recall graphite and saline. A silky, persistent perlage provides loads of finesse while bright acidity lends intensity and precision. Extraordinary.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Designation: Riserva del Fondatore Rosé Extra Brut
Name: Ferrari 2008 Riserva del Fondatore Rosé Extra Brut Sparkling (Trento)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This wonderful wine layers together subtle red fruit, cinnamon, tamarind and savory, meaty accents for an extraordinarily complex outcome. Mouthfilling and rich in texture but also lively and bright in underlying acidity, it is beautifully balanced and will age well. Best from 2023.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Schramsberg 2012 J. Schram Rosé Sparkling (North Coast)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: Complexity and seamlessness are the hallmarks of this elegant, crisp and well-aged wine made from 80% Pinot Noir and 20% Chardonnay. From aromas of toasted walnut and ginger to tangy white-peach, almond and tamarind flavors, this layered and creamy-textured sparkler builds great interest and ends with a lingering finish. Best from 2023.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Schramsberg 2011 Reserve Sparkling (North Coast)

Description: Aromas of mature white stone fruit, citrus and bread crust carry over to the focused, elegantly structured palate along with notes of honey and almond. Bright acidity gives it a crisp finish while an extremely refined perlage of tiny, continuous bubbles lends finesse.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Designation: Cuvée Aurora Pas Dosé 100 Mesi Riserva
Name: Banfi 2010 Cuvée Aurora Pas Dosé 100 Mesi Riserva Sparkling (Alta Langa)

Description: A blend of 80% Pinot Nero and 20% Chardonnay, this radiant sparkler offers enticing aromas of ripe white stone fruit, brioche and yellow spring flower. The palate boasts freshness and depth, delivering pomegranate, bread crust, white peach and hazelnut. Crisp acidity brightens the rich flavors while an elegant, persistent perlage lends finesse.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Gancia 2013 Cuvée 36 Mesi Brut Sparkling (Alta Langa)

Description: Aromas of chamomile, acacia honey and bread crust follow over to the focused palate along with ripe yellow apple, cedar, hazelnut and citrus. Vibrant acidity keeps it remarkably fresh and energized while a silky, continuous perlage lends finesse.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Gancia 2011 Cuvée 60 Mesi Riserva Brut Sparkling (Alta Langa)

Description: Radiant and loaded with finesse, this has aromas of ripe white stone fruit, brioche and lemon zest. The aromas carry on to the racy, bone-dry palate along with mineral notes suggesting saline and briny oyster shell. A lively, elegant perlage and crisp acidity provide the energized setting.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Giribaldi 2015 Matteo Giribaldi Pas Dosé Sparkling (Alta Langa)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This pale-pink, tangy and sophisticated sparkling wine tastes bone dry, appetizing and complex, offering subtle raspberry, ginger and cinnamon flavors buoyed by crisp acidity and impressively tiny bubbles. It's an outstanding first sparkling wine from this Chardonnay and Pinot Noir specialist.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Tongue Dancer 2015 Brut Rosé Sparkling (Anderson Valley)

Description: Delicate aromas of mature white stone fruit, bread crust and toasted nut make their way to the forefront. Made with 85% Pinot Nero and 15% Chardonnay, the elegant, structured palate offers acacia honey, chamomile, dried yellow-apple slices and bitter almond alongside a refined perlage. Firm acidity lifts the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Enrico Serafino 2007 Pas Dosé Riserva Zero 140 Sparkling (Alta Langa)

Description: Chamomile, hay, hazelnut and red-berry aromas form the appealing nose. On the elegantly sparkling palate, bright acidity lifts sour cherry, apple and pomegranate before a bread-crust close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ferrari 2015 Perlé Rosé Brut Riserva Sparkling (Trento)

Description: Fresh and savory, this elegant sparkler hits all the right buttons. Made with Pinot Nero and 20% Chardonnay, it features ripe white stone fruit, juicy red berry and brioche set against a refined, persistent perlage. Lively acidity keeps it bright and balanced.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Gancia NV Brut 19 Mesi Sparkling (Piemonte)

Description: Hawthorn, brioche and white stone fruit aromas carry over to the palate along with yellow apple and citrus zest. Saline mineral notes back up the crisp finish while a polished perlage lends elegance.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bel Colle 2016 Cuvée Valentina Nature Sparkling (Alta Langa)

Description: Racy and focused, this opens with delicate aromas of red berry, brioche and spring wild flower. On the crisp, dry palate, vibrant acidity accompanies pomegranate, tangy citrus and a hint of saline. A lively, refined perlage provides the backdrop.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Oro Rosso NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Trento)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This was disgorged in September 2020 after four years en tirage. It's a crisp, clean, fresh and youthful sparkling wine, all Pinot Noir but more like a Blanc de Blancs in flavors. Grapefruit, apple and white peach fruit mix together, with a fine mousse and moderate aging potential.                      Paul Gregutt
Designation: Coles Valley Vineyard Blanc de Noir
Name: The Great Oregon Wine Company 2016 Coles Valley Vineyard Blanc de Noir Sparkling (Umpqua Valley)

Description: Aromas of bread crust, toasted nut, graphite and ripe stone fruit waft out of the glass. The aromas carry over to the racy, linear palate along with lemon drop and ginger set against a lively perlage.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Corte Giacobbe NV Brut Sparkling (Vino Spumante)

Description: This was given an American label, but don't be fooled—this is all Willamette Valley fruit. Strawberry and raspberry aromas lead to bright, fresh flavors. There's a lot to like.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Battle Creek NV Yamhela Vineyard Blanc de Noir Sparkling (America)

Description: Aromas of hawthorn, white stone fruit and brioche form the delicate nose on this silky sparkler. On the dry, vibrant palate, crisp acidity accompanies mature yellow apple, bread crust and honeyed notes.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Oro Rosso NV Dosaggio Zero Sparkling (Trento)

Description: Aromas of bread crust, rose and red berry lift out of the glass. Reflecting the nose, the racy palate offers pomegranate, sour cherry, blood orange and a hint of hazelnut alongside a lively perlage.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ferrari NV Rosé Brut Metodo Classico Sparkling (Trento)

Description: A blend of Chardonnay and Pinot Nero, this has aromas of bread crust and walnut. The aromas follow over to the palate along with butterscotch, mature yellow-apple skin and a dollop of vanilla. A lively perlage provides the setting.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Lungarotti 2016 Brut Sparkling (Vino Spumante)

Description: Subtle aromas of botanical herb, hawthorn and cedar form the nose while the dry palate offers yellow apple, grapefruit and walnut. Crisp acidity and a lively perlage provide the backdrop.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Designation: Metodo Classico Blanc de Noir Dosaggio Zero
Name: Dorigo NV Metodo Classico Blanc de Noir Dosaggio Zero Sparkling (Vino Spumante)

Description: Made with Pinot Grigio and Sangiovese, this has delicate aromas suggesting pressed rose, bread crust and botanical herb. The supple palate shows sour cherry, hazelnut and a candied note alongside bright acidity and a soft perlage.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Lungarotti NV Rosé Brut Sparkling (Vino Spumante)

Description: White spring flower and white stone fruit aromas waft out of the glass. The gently sparkling palate offers yellow apple, citrus and a hint of bread crust alongside crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Dorigo NV Metodo Classico Brut Sparkling (Vino Spumante)

Description: Aromas of brioche and white spring flower form the delicate nose on this pretty sparkler. The palate offers creamy yellow apple, tangy lemon drop and a hint of almond alongside firm acidity and a lively perlage.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Oro Rosso NV Brut Sparkling (Trento)

Description: Aromas of brioche, underbrush and hazelnut mingle together. On the lively palate, invigorating bubbles accompany juicy sour cherry, orange zest and a hint of walnut.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Dal Cero NV Rosé Brut Camely Sparkling (Vino Spumante)

Description: Aromas suggesting toasted nut and a whiff of adhesive bandage form the subdued nose. On the lean and racy palate, brisk acidity accompanies suggestions of medicinal herb, lemon rind and bitter walnut.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Lungarotti 2014 Extra Brut Sparkling (Vino Spumante)

Description: This dry and lean, bottle-fermented wine tastes refreshing and reserved, holding its subtle cranberry and cherry flavors very tightly with nervy acidity and crisp bubbles.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Peltier 2018 The Gala  (Lodi)

Description: Aromas of medicinal herb, grapefruit, lily flower and adhesive bandage follow over to the dry palate along with bitter almond and yellow-apple skin. Racy acidity and steely bubbles create a lean close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Jako Wine 2015 Metodo Classico Pas Dosé Sparkling (Vino Spumante)

Description: Light and attractive lemon-cream and crisp apple flavors fill out this medium-bodied, dry and rather soft-textured wine that is smooth and easy on the palate.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Barefoot Bubbly NV Brut Cuvée Sparkling (California)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Spark is a light, crown-capped blend of Pinot Blanc, Pinot Noir and Chasselas Doré. Despite the low alcohol it's finished dry, with simple, pleasant flavors of watermelon and strawberry. It's basically a blended rosé with light carbonation added.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: The Eyrie Vineyards NV Spark Sparkling (Willamette Valley)

Description: A hint of sweetness rounds the edges of this lightly fruity and floral wine. A soft effervescence carries fresh apple and subtle pistachio flavors.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Barefoot Bubbly NV Extra Dry Sparkling (California)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This crown-capped pét-nat has scents of hay and funk, with light apple fruit flavors. It's like drinking an apple-flavored sparkling water—refreshing, simple and evanescent.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Ransom 2019 Frizzante Bianco Pinot Noir Sparkling (Eola-Amity Hills)

Description: Lovely in peach color, this estate-grown wine combines 58% Pinot Noir with 42% Chardonnay. Effusive in strawberry, grapefruit, lemon rind and wet stone, it is textured and complex, with beautiful waves of floral aromas and juicy succulence that lingers on the finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Domaine Carneros 2016 Brut Rosé Estate Grown Sparkling (Carneros)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is the first rosé in the winery's expanding sparkling wine program. Aged over four years, including 44 months en tirage, it was disgorged in the fall of 2019. A blend of of 70% Pinot Noir and 30% Chardonnay, it is scented with lavender and shows flavors of plum, seltzer, cherry and white chocolate. The bracing acidity is refreshing, and despite its generous aging program, the wine remains youthful and impeccably fresh.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Domaine Serene NV M.V.1 Evenstad Reserve Brut Rosé Sparkling (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is the first demi-sec in the winery's expanding sparkling wine program. Aged over four years, including 44 months en tirage, it was disgorged in the fall of 2019. A blend of 60% Pinot Noir and 40% Chardonnay, it leans into flavors of tangerine and apricot accented by flowers. Though labeled demi-sec, it's not so sweet that it can't work with a wide variety of appetizers and entrées.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Domaine Serene NV M.V.1 Fleur de Vie Demi-Sec Sparkling (Dundee Hills)

Description: A Pinot Noir-dominated Champagne, this is richly textured and showing attractive signs of maturity. The toastiness is balanced by crispness with a tangy lemon flavor that broadens into ripe apples. Drink this seductive wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: G. H. Mumm 2013 Brut Millésimé  (Champagne)

Description: A blend of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay from Grand and Premier Cru vineyards, this Champagne is impressively rich. Still young, its taut texture and minerality are imbued with elegance as well as freshness. This is a style of wine that can age for many years so, although it could be drunk now, it will improve at least until 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Taittinger 2014 Brut Millésimé  (Champagne)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is the second release from the winery's ambitious new sparkling wine program. Aged over four years, including 44 months en tirage, it was disgorged in the summer of 2019. The fruit remains vivid and rich, though not too dominant. Bursting with a crisp apple flavor, it's focused and lightly toasty and should age well through 2035.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Domaine Serene NV M.V.2 Evenstad Reserve Brut Sparkling (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This new sparkling wine specialist debuts with four different wines from the 2017 vintage. This single-vineyard selection from old Chardonnay vines in the Van Duzer Corridor is forward and toasty, with prominent and delicious flavors of apple, melon and papaya. There's a fine, precise bead and perfect acid balance. This is the highlight of a strong debut.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Corollary 2017 Namaste Vineyard Blanc de Blanc Sparkling (Willamette Valley)

Description: With a slight dominance of Chardonnay, this sparkler is nutty and earthy on the nose, inviting one in with hazelnut and crème brûlée. Bracing and racy with structure and texture, it has a long finish marked by green apple and pear.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Domaine Carneros 2015 Brut Estate Grown Sparkling (Carneros)

Description: From 53% Chardonnay and 47% Pinot Noir, both grown by the producer, this dry, graceful sparkler is racy and sublime. Lemon peel, zest and sharp green apple echo the tangy acidity and help to emphasize the sleek structure.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Domaine Carneros 2015 Ultra Brut Estate Grown Sparkling (Carneros)

Description: After three years in bottle, this sparkling combines 50% Chardonnay with 40% Pinot Noir and a touch of Pinot Gris. Earthy mushroom and muddled lime, lemon and apple flavors highlight a smooth, structured palate of ample length and rounded weight.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Domaine Carneros 2016 Brut Sparkling (Carneros)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Winemaker Dianna Novy combines 59% Pinot Noir and 41% Chardonnay into this lovely brut, which spent three years on the lees. Oyster shell, peach and green apple highlight a lovely, balanced burst of persistent bubbles.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Flaunt 2017 Brut Sparkling (Russian River Valley)

Description: Nearly equal parts Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, this sparkler is steely and dry, with a crisp focus on flavors of oyster shell and lemon rind. The acidity persists throughout, highlighting the brightness of lime and lemon.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Domaine Carneros 2014 Ultra Brut Estate Grown Sparkling (Carneros)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Done in the Méthode Traditionnelle, this vintage-dated brut is the first Oregon sparkler from La Crema. It opens crisp and clean, showing little impact from four years en tirage. There is green-apple fruit and sharp acidity but little complexity. Give it ample aeration (open the bottle, re-seal it, and let it sit for some hours) and it shows much better, with touches of straw, toast, citrus and good length and texture. Drink 2024–2035.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: La Crema 2015 Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This new sparkling wine specialist debuts with four different wines from the 2017 vintage. Tart lemon and strawberry flavors characterize this pure Pinot Noir. It spent six months in barrel and 18 on the lees prior to being disgorged in December 2019. It's fresh and clean, sets its course from the first sip and holds true through the finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Corollary 2017 Cattrall Brothers Vineyard Rosé Brut Sparkling (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: An appealing shade of pale pink with a slight hint of rose gold in the glass, this bottling begins with fresh aromas of rose petals, lily and tangerine rind, with a slightly yeasty hint. The palate shows tightly woven plum-skin and orange-zest flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Sanford 2016 Brut Rosé Sparkling (Sta. Rita Hills)

Description: This new sparkling wine specialist debuts with four different wines from the 2017 vintage. This is fresh and vivid, with crisp green-apple fruit that touches lightly on green melon. There's a gentle hint of peach, and the acids are in good proportion for young bubbly. The blend is half Pinot Noir, one-third Chardonnay and the rest Pinot Blanc.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Corollary 2017 Cuvée One Brut Sparkling (Oregon)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Creamy yeast and mellow Golden Delicious apple unite into a seductive aroma, enhanced by a vivid note of pithy lemon peel. The mellowness continues right onto the palate, where cream and lemon support and soothe the vivid apple notions. There is a lovely, enticing saltiness to the yeast that counters the richness of this supersmooth sparkler.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Guillemot-Michel 2017 Une Bulle Méthode Ancestrale Sparkling (Vin de France)

Description: With its tight acidity and steely texture, this is a young wine, showing fresh acidity and grapefruit flavors. It has poise and a good balance between fruit and texture that will allow it to age further. Drink from mid-2021. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Designation: Cuvée Gaia Blanc de Blancs Brut
Name: Celene NV Cuvée Gaia Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Crémant de Bordeaux)

Description: This blend of Bordeaux white grapes emphasizes Sémillon and Muscadelle, producing a rich and creamy wine. It is perfumed, ripe and crisp with white fruits and acidity. Now mature, the wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Designation: Cave Royale Cuvée de Réserve Brut
Name: Celene 2016 Cave Royale Cuvée de Réserve Brut  (Crémant de Bordeaux)

Description: The normally unruly Baga grape makes good sparkling wine in this oceanic region. With a fresh apple fruitiness the wine is crisply textured, with tight acidity, light structure and a lemon aftertaste. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Global Wines 2015 Encontro Reserva Brut Sparkling (Bairrada)

Description: Pure Cabernet Franc has given a rich, perfumed while also racy wine. It has a light tannic edge as well as strawberry fruitiness. The bottling is just right with some age. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Celene NV Black Pearl Brut  (Crémant de Bordeaux)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This new sparkling wine specialist debuts with four different wines from the 2017 vintage. The winery notes it's carbonic, and the deep-rose color signals the impact of the skins. In the mouth it's almost foamy, with light, frothy fruit flavors of black cherry augmented with earth and stem.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Corollary 2017 Momtazi Vineyard Rosé Brut Sparkling (Willamette Valley)

Description: Lightly perfumed and deliciously crisp, this sparkling wine is a lively blend of Encruzado, Bical and Malvasia. The three grapes bring a creamy texture, a bright and taut structure and final perfumes. Drink the wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Global Wines 2016 Cabriz Bruto Sparkling (Dão)

Description: Light and pale in color, this fruity rosé is attractively perfumed with aromas of blossoms and crushed strawberries. Acidity gives the wine a lift. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Calvet 2018 Brut Rosé  (Crémant de Bordeaux)

Description: Aged for 12 months before disgorgement, this fruity blend of Cabernet Franc and Merlot is full of soft and rounded red-fruit flavors. The emphasis is on fruitiness, fresh and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Celene NV Cuvée Royale Rosé Brut  (Crémant de Bordeaux)

Description: A floral wine, this is crisp and fragrant. With touches of yellow fruits that contrast with the orange zestiness, the wine is ripe, fruity and needing a few more months. Drink from mid-2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Celene NV Opale Brut Blanc de Blancs  (Crémant de Bordeaux)

Description: Bottled without added sulfur, this sparkling wine has some maturity, hinting at oxidation that has softened the yellow-fruit flavors. It is ready to drink, perfumed and fruity at the end.                      Roger Voss
Designation: Quartz Brut Nature Blanc de Blancs
Name: Celene NV Quartz Brut Nature Blanc de Blancs  (Crémant de Bordeaux)

Description: Bottled without added sulfur, this sparkling wine has some maturity, hinting at oxidation that has softened the yellow-fruit flavors. It is ready to drink, perfumed and fruity at the end.                      Roger Voss
Designation: Quartz Brut Nature Blanc de Blancs
Name: Celene NV Quartz Brut Nature Blanc de Blancs  (Crémant de Bordeaux)

Description: Soft and creamy with freshness over light acidity and kiwi-fruit flavors, this wine is bright and ready to drink. Dominated by Cabernet Franc, the blend finishes with attractively perfumed acidity.                      Roger Voss
Name: Celene NV Ballarin Brut  (Crémant de Bordeaux)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Vivid citrus and pear drop notes dominate the wine's open, appetizing nose. The rounded palate comes with gentle pear fruit and still some of that zesty citrus. The bubbles are easy and foamy, and the finish is dry.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Champliau NV Petrone 68 Brut Sparkling (Vin de France)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Notes of fresh pea and pear drop are lively on the nose, carried by frothy foam. The body is easy, smooth, fresh and simple and adds a little citrus freshness to the pear flavors before coming to a dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: René Briand NV Blanc de Blancs Brut Sparkling (Vin de France)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This fresh, clean and simple bubbly was force-carbonated which must be some version of the Charmat process. The advantages are many, as no time-and-labor-consuming aging is required. The flavors are light and generic, with apple and lemon skin mostly, and the fizz lacks the precision and persistence of the champagne method. But it's a serviceable mixer and should be consumed over the next year or two.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Naumes 2019 Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Rogue Valley)

Description: Aged for 12 months before disgorgement, this is a smoothly textured blend of Merlot and Cabernet Franc. It has a creamy texture, ripe strawberry flavors and light acidity. The wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Maison Bertrand Ravache NV L'Instant Bordeaux Brut Rosé  (Crémant de Bordeaux)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Hints of red apple and strawberry on the nose are toned down on the fresh, slender, light palate. Apple is joined by citrus on the palate and comes together on the dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: René Briand NV Rosé Brut Sparkling (Vin de France)

Description: Lemony and spicy, this wine is perfumed and softly textured. A biscuit edge to the taste suggests some bottle aging. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Celene NV Cuvée Royale Brut  (Crémant de Bordeaux)

Description: A blend of Chardonnay and Chenin Blanc, this is fruity, freshly textured and gently crisp and perfumed. The wine's green apple flavors are still fresh and bright at the end. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Designation: Paul Louis Blanc de Blancs Brut
Name: Veuve Amiot NV Paul Louis Blanc de Blancs Brut Sparkling (Vin Mousseux)

Description: A softly textured sparkling wine, hinting at red fruits as well as crisper citrus. It has attractive, finishing acidity.                      Roger Voss
Designation: B. François Blanc de Blancs Brut
Name: Veuve Amiot NV B. François Blanc de Blancs Brut Sparkling (Vin Mousseux)

Description: A blend of 70% Pinot Nero and 30% Chardonnay, this compelling, focused sparkler offers aromas of white spring flower and bread dough. Made with organically farmed grapes, the pristine, delicious palate offers white stone fruit, alpine herb and juicy Meyer lemon alongside savory saline mineral notes. Crisp acidity and an elegant perlage provide energy and finesse. For lovers of bone-dry, elegant bubbly, this is for you.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Maso Martis 2016 Dosaggio Zero Riserva Sparkling (Trento)

Description: Delicate aromas of white stone fruit, yellow spring flower and a whiff of bread crust form the delicate, enticing nose on this bone-dry sparkler. It's elegant, vibrant and delicious, doling out ripe apple, pear and a hint of ginger set against an extremely refined perlage. Bright, tangy acidity gives it a crisp, pristine finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ettore Germano 2016 Metodo Classico Extra Brut Sparkling (Alta Langa)

Description: Aromas of wild berry, freshly baked bread and alpine herb lead the nose, along with whiffs of cake spice and pink grapefruit. The silky palate shows structure and finesse, delivering juicy strawberry, pomegranate, white pepper and white almond alongside racy acidity and an elegant perlage.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Revi 2016 Rosé Brut Sparkling (Trento)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Lively aromas of crisp apple, lychee, lemon peel, jasmine and apricot blossom show on the nose of this sparkling Viognier, which spent six years en tirage. The complexity comes through on the palate, where apple-skin and lemon-flesh flavors meet with the wet stone minerality.                      Matt Kettmann
Designation: Blanc de Blanc Extended Tirage Hastings Ranch Vineyard
Name: Thacher 2013 Blanc de Blanc Extended Tirage Hastings Ranch Vineyard Sparkling (Adelaida District)

Description: Crisp, dry and structured, this dazzling sparkler has aromas of yellow apple, pear, camphor and bread crust. The aromas follow over to the dry palate along with lemon drop and a sprinkling of ginger. A silky perlage provides loads of finesse while fresh acidity keeps it focused.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fratelli Berlucchi 2012 Casa delle Colonne Brut  (Franciacorta)

Description: Bone-dry and elegant, this polished sparkler has aromas of spring wildflower, honey, white stone fruit and bread crust. On the vibrant palate, a silky perlage accompanies ripe yellow apple, peach and ginger before finishing on an almond note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Berlucchi 2012 '61 Nature Dosaggio Zero  (Franciacorta)

Description: Delicate scents of hawthorn and white stone fruit form the nose on this bone-dry sparkler. Racy and focused, the precise, savory palate delivers apple, pear, ginger and citrus alongside a refined, continuous perlage. It's full of energy, with bright acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bonfadini 2016 Victus Nature  (Franciacorta)

Description: Aromas of bread crust, mature white stone fruit and a delicate whiff of forest floor form the alluring nose. Elegant and structured, the palate delivers ripe yellow apple, toasted hazelnut, ginger and a dollop of vanilla alongside a refined, persistent perlage. It has intriguing depth and complexity while fresh acidity keeps it vibrant.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Maso Martis 2010 Rare Vintage Riserva Sparkling (Trento)

Description: Creamy richness brimming with Red Delicious and buttery shortbread notes defines both the nose and this wine. On the palate, rounded, creamy and rich autolysis surrounds the central freshness with its salted butter notes and apple ripeness. The foam is smooth and the palate is concentrated. Freshness is pristine and the finish dry.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Paul Chollet 2015 Concerto Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: Strawberry shortcake notes abound on the fresh nose of this wine, which conveys the fresh fruit, creaminess and richness of the pastry. The palate puts these all in a tight, fresh corset, vivid with liveliness. Fine foam makes everything exuberant and bright. The finish is alluring and dry.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Bailly-Lapierre 2013 Vive-la-Joie Rosé Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: Handsome and fully mature, this well-aged bottle of bubbles is all about complexity. Tempting aromas of toasted walnuts and buttered baguettes are backed by mellow lemon and tangerine notes that keep the palate fresh from the start to the lingering finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Schramsberg 2011 J. Schram Sparkling (North Coast)

Description: Fresh and candied lemon, cream and angelfood cake figure on the enticing, bright nose of this wine. The tight palate brings in an earthy edge of autolysis that has richness and dimension. Framed with yeasty saltiness and freshness, the wine presents a body of elegance and restraint. It's long and bone dry.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Louis Bouillot NV Fine Réserve Extra-Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: Chamomile, yellow-pear, citrus-zest and bread-crust aromas shape the nose on this blend of 60% Chardonnay and 40% Pinot Nero. On the elegantly structured, creamy palate, a refined perlage accompanies mature yellow apple, orange rind, walnut and vanilla. Fresh acidity brightens the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bellavista 2013 Vittorio Moretti  (Franciacorta)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: Lively citrus flavors are nicely tempered by almond and bread-dough nuances in this elegant, well-balanced and rich-tasting wine. It offers more than fresh fruit, adding aged-on-the-lees complexity for a very tempting expression.                      Jim Gordon
Designation: Blanc de Blancs Méthode Traditionnelle Brut
Name: Schramsberg 2017 Blanc de Blancs Méthode Traditionnelle Brut Sparkling (North Coast)

Description: A blend of 90% Chardonnay and Pinot Nero, this elegant, focused sparkler has aromas of bread crust, wild herb and ripe white stone fruit. Made with no dosage, the racy palate features mature yellow apple, Meyer lemon and toasted hazelnut set against an elegant, persistent perlage. Vibrant acidity lifts the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: 1701 2013 Dosaggio Zero Riserva  (Franciacorta)

Description: Bone-dry and savory, this focused sparkler has delicate, enticing scents of aromatic herb, white stone fruit and yellow field flower. On the racy palate, crisp acidity accompanies Bartlett pear, Anjou pear, citrus zest and flinty mineral notes. An elegant perlage provides finesse.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ca' dei Zago 2018 Metodo Classico Dosaggio Zero  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco)

Description: Notes of honeyed sponge cake and gingerbread on this wine's nose immediately promise evolution and richness. The palate follows with concentration and intensity, showing evolved notes of candied lemon peel and that gingerbread vibe. There is roundness and heightened freshness, flanked by candied-citrus richness. The finish is fresh, smooth, dry and long.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Louis Bouillot 2012 Perle d'Or Brut Milléseimé  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: Bread-crust, chamomile, underbrush and mature yellow stone-fruit aromas form the nose on this dry, intriguing sparkler. At 11 years old, it shows complexity and freshness, offering toasted hazelnut, mature golden apple, unsweetened lemon drop and a hint of saline before closing on a coffee-bean note. A refined perlage provides finesse.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Antica Fratta 2009 Quintessence Extra Brut Riserva  (Franciacorta)

Description: Aromas of white stone fruit, bread crust and Mediterranean brush shape the inviting nose. Creamy and fresh, the bright palate delivers ripe apple, pear, pastry dough and hazelnut alongside fresh acidity and an elegant perlage.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantine di Marzo NV Metodo Classcio Extra Brut 1930 Sparkling (Vino Spumante)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Dry and complex in lemon zest, green apple and stone fruit, this wine has benefitted from extra time in bottle, showing a lovely persistence of acidity and texture. A hint of oyster shell continues its salty, silky and savory complements.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Paradise Ridge 2012 Blanc de Blanc Late Disgorge Sparkling (Russian River Valley)

Description: Enticingly delicate aromas of chamomile, white stone fruit and bread crust mingle with whiffs of orange-citrus zest on this dry, elegant sparkler. Incredibly youthful for an 11-year-old wine, it's well balanced, featuring mature yellow apple, white peach, ginger and a dollop of vanilla set against a silky perlage. Fresh acidity brightens the rich flavors. This proves the serious aging potential of top wines from the denomination.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Berlucchi 2009 Palazzo Lana Extra Brut Riserva  (Franciacorta)

Description: Aromas suggesting bread crust, mature stone fruit and yellow spring flower form the inviting nose. Creamy and vibrant, the savory palate doles out ripe yellow apple, orange drop, apricot and toasted hazelnut alongside a refined, persistent perlage. Bright acidity keeps it crisp.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Designation: Riserva del Fondatore Vincenzo Comi Brut
Name: Travaglino 2011 Riserva del Fondatore Vincenzo Comi Brut Sparkling (Oltrepò Pavese)

Description: Vanilla-scented notes of ripe, yellow apple fill this wine's nose with generous, precise mellowness. This sense of vanilla, salted butter and apple expands on the slender palate, adding depth rather than weight. The lemony, chalky core serves as a wellspring of brightness and freshness. It's bone dry and compelling.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Clotilde Davenne 2006 Brut Extra  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: Made with 85% Pinot Nero and 15% Chardonnay, this has inviting aromas of bread dough, red berry, eucalyptus and baking spice. The aromas follow through to the focused palate, along with pomegranate, hazelnut and star anise set against a refined perlage. Vibrant acidity lifts the finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Enrico Serafino 2016 Oudeis Brut Sparkling (Alta Langa)

Description: Intriguing aromas include smoke, charcuterie and bread crust on this 100% Chardonnay sparkler. The aromas carry over to the elegantly sparkling palate along with juicy white peach, grilled herb and lemon drop. It's surprisingly fresh for an eight-year-old bottling, but also has complexity. A silky perlage keeps it polished.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: La Montina 2012 Brut  (Franciacorta)

Description: Vanilla-scented notes of ripe, yellow apple fill this wine's nose with generous, precise mellowness. This sense of vanilla, salted butter and apple expands on the slender palate, adding depth rather than weight. The lemony, chalky core serves as a wellspring of brightness and freshness. It's bone dry and compelling.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Clotilde Davenne 2006 Brut Extra  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: Aromas suggesting bread crust, mature stone fruit and yellow spring flower form the inviting nose. Creamy and vibrant, the savory palate doles out ripe yellow apple, orange drop, apricot and toasted hazelnut alongside a refined, persistent perlage. Bright acidity keeps it crisp.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Designation: Riserva del Fondatore Vincenzo Comi Brut
Name: Travaglino 2011 Riserva del Fondatore Vincenzo Comi Brut Sparkling (Oltrepò Pavese)

Description: Dry and classy, this racy sparkler opens with delicate scents recalling spring wild flower and white stone fruit. The elegant, vibrant palate delivers yellow apple, Meyer lemon, bread crust and an energizing mineral note suggesting wet stone set against a polished, persistent perlage.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Mirabella 2013 Demetra Extra Brut  (Franciacorta)

Description: A hint of wild strawberry flickers on this wine's subtle nose amid dried orange-peel notes. On the palate, rounded richness sets the tone, pitched against a fine line of citrus freshness. The foam is lively, creamy and fruity, with bottled strawberry mellowness. It has depth and resonance, while lovely notes of truffle begin to appear in the red-fruited backdrop. The wine is beautiful and layered.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: JCB 2014 No. 13 Rosé Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: Notes of ripe Mirabelle and dried apricot point to some evolution on the nose. The fine foam and richness on the palate carry the same, presenting concentrated, mellow freshness and fine, smooth, salty and yeasty autolysis. While elegant and smooth, the palate has a spine of freshness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave L'Aurance 2015 Brut Milléseimé  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: Golden Delicious apple and salty yeast figure prominently on this wine's generous nose. The palate has a creamy, mellow texture, presenting fine, smooth bubbles that add excitement to the ripe apple notes. The bony-dry finish reverberates with yeasty, appetizing length.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Paul Chollet NV Brut Zéro  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: A high-toned notion of candied lemon peel melds into an herbal savoriness recalling crushed yarrow on the nose of this wine. The taut body shows wonderful signs of evolution, with a creamy, honeyed core of freshness that's now mellowing. Slenderness is made rich by depth and a sense of bitter honeycomb. All this is set off by lemony freshness and carried by lively foam.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Clotilde Davenne 2011 Brut Extra  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: Notes of ripe Mirabelle and dried apricot point to some evolution on the nose. The fine foam and richness on the palate carry the same, presenting concentrated, mellow freshness and fine, smooth, salty and yeasty autolysis. While elegant and smooth, the palate has a spine of freshness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave L'Aurance 2015 Brut Milléseimé  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fiano is starting to become slightly more popular in California, but sparkling Fiano remains a complete anomaly. As this bottling reveals, it works, starting with aromas of orange rind, corn bread, dried white flower and rust. The palate packs dried pear and mellow mango flavors into the foamy mousse.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Equinox 2017 Brut Ultra Fiano Cuvée Sparkling (Santa Clara Valley)

Description: Vibrant and linear, this tangy sparkler offers aromas of rose, red berry and a hint of pastry dough. On the racy palate, small, continuous bubbles and lively acidity accompany juicy red cherry, pomegranate, citrus and bread crust before a dry, crisp finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: G D Vajra NV N.S. della Neve Metodo Classico Sparkling (Vino Spumante)

Description: Aromas of pressed chamomile, bread crust and citrus zest waft out of the glass. It's bone-dry and racy, delivering juicy grapefruit, yellow apple and saline alongside a lively, elegant perlage.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: La Montina 2011 Baiana Pas Dosé Riserva  (Franciacorta)

Description: Aromas of yellow apple, bread crust and hazelnut carry on to the dry, racy palate along with lemon zest, Bartlett pear and a hint of ginger. Vibrant acidity and an elegant, persistent perlage present the energized setting.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Corte Fusia 2014 Dosaggio Zero  (Franciacorta)

Description: Aromas of pressed chamomile, bread crust and citrus zest waft out of the glass. It's bone-dry and racy, delivering juicy grapefruit, yellow apple and saline alongside a lively, elegant perlage.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: La Montina 2011 Baiana Pas Dosé Riserva  (Franciacorta)

Description: Aromas of yellow apple, bread crust and hazelnut carry on to the dry, racy palate along with lemon zest, Bartlett pear and a hint of ginger. Vibrant acidity and an elegant, persistent perlage present the energized setting.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Corte Fusia 2014 Dosaggio Zero  (Franciacorta)

Description: White stone-fruit, bread-crust and hay aromas form the nose on this linear sparkler. On the bone-dry, rather lean palate, racy acidity accompanies yellow apple, unsweetened lemon drop and white almond alongside an elegant, continuous perlage.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Dorigo NV Blanc de Blancs Pas Dosé Sparkling (Vino Spumante)

Description: Red apple and dried orange peel form the chief aromas on this wine's vivid nose. The palate follows with rounded mellowness bedded on creamy foam and rich yeastiness. Textured, pithy freshness pulls everything into focus. Concentrated and bold, this wine would be a gorgeous, rounded and dry winter aperitif.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: JCB NV No. 69 Rosé Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: Apple flesh, rye bread and lemon peel make appearances on this wine's subtle nose. They also feature on the palate, accentuated by the fine, gentle foam. This wine is harmonious, fresh and vivid, with a long finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Bailly-Lapierre 2017 Egarade  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: Aromas of toasted bread crust, mature stone fruit and a whiff of honeyed nut form the nose. The aromas carry on to the vibrant palate along with mature golden apple and white peach before closing on a bitter-almond note. A refined perlage accompanies the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ricci Curbastro 2010 Gualberto Dosaggio Zero  (Franciacorta)

Description: Ripe yellow apple is edged with lemon on this wine's nose. On the palate that richness is pulled into taut, slender focus by full lemon freshness. Salty tanginess clings to the yeasty backdrop, making this wine totally appetizing with its apple, lemon and salt combo on the dry, long finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Clotilde Davenne NV Brut Extra  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: Aromas of toasted bread crust, mature stone fruit and a whiff of honeyed nut form the nose. The aromas carry on to the vibrant palate along with mature golden apple and white peach before closing on a bitter-almond note. A refined perlage accompanies the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ricci Curbastro 2010 Gualberto Dosaggio Zero  (Franciacorta)

Description: Mature yellow stone-fruit, bread crust and baking-spice aromas waft out of the glass. On the palate, a silky perlage accompanies lemon drop, golden apple and toasted hazelnut. Fresh acidity lifts the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ronco Calino 2012 Brut  (Franciacorta)

Description: A blend of 70% Pinot Nero and 30% Chardonnay, this has delicate scents of white stone fruit and bread crust. The elegantly sparkling palate offers yellow apple, ginger and of citrus alongside a refined perlage. It closes on a hint of white almond.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: San Silvestro 2015 Dosaggio Zero Sparkling (Alta Langa)

Description: Tangy and creamy, this savory sparkler doles out ripe yellow apple, Bartlett pear and white peach alongside crisp acidity. Small, persistent bubbles provide the background while notes of lemon drop and almond grace the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ferghettina NV Brut  (Franciacorta)

Description: Made with 90% Pinot Nero and 10% Chardonnay, this has alluring aromas of field flower, ripe apple, tropical fruit and wild herb. On the dry, radiant palate, firm acidity and a lively perlage accompany white peach, vanilla and lemon drop, before finishing on notes of thyme and bitter almond.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bel Colle 2016 Cuvée Valentina Extra Brut Sparkling (Alta Langa)

Description: A fifty-fifty blend of Chardonnay and Pinot Nero, this dry, elegant sparkler has aromas of bread crust and mature white stone fruit. The vibrant, linear palate reveals ripe golden apple, pomegranate and a hint of saline alongside small, continuous bubbles. It closes on a hazelnut note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bonfadini 2015 Aurora Rosé  (Franciacorta)

Description: Aromas of bread crust and saline carry over to the racy palate along with yellow apple and pomegranate. Vibrant acidity and a lively perlage provide the energized setting.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Antica Fratta 2015 Essence Rosé Brut  (Franciacorta)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This pét-nat of Grenache Blanc from Mission Ranch Vineyard is cloudy in the glass and refreshing on the nose, with plenty of grapefruit zest, river stones, lime and a hint of riper pear. The palate picks up an Asian pear note and amplifies the wet rock minerality. It is fun and flavorful.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Folktale 2019 Talking Animals Pétillant Naturel Sparkling (Monterey County)

Description: Delicate scents evoking white stone fruit, underbrush and spring flower mingle with whiffs of bread dough on this 60% Pinot Nero and 40% Chardonnay. Elegantly sparkling, the linear palate doles out mature yellow apple, hazelnut, botanical herb and citrus zest alongside crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Giribaldi 2016 Matteo Giribaldi Sparkling (Alta Langa)

Description: Creamy yeast on the nose of this wine blends with a high note of dried lemon peel and hint of bitter fir honey. The palate adds a sense of wet chalk and a yeasty, creamy texture, still with that bitter glint of fir honey. With its concentration, well-rounded freshness and considerable flavor, this sparkler will do well with subtle food.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: JCB 2009 No. 39 Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: This wine's shy nose reveals only lemony hints of chalk. Touches of Mirabelle appear on the palate alongside more notions of chalk and lemon, presented against a textured backdrop on a taut body. The finish is dry, subtle and enticing.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Parigot & Richard NV La Sentinelle Extra Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: Focused and savory, this refined sparkler has aromas of chamomile, white stone fruit, orange zest and baked bread. The aromas follow over to the bright, linear palate along with a hint of lemon drop. A silky perlage and bright acidity provide the backdrop.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Scacciadiavoli NV Metodo Classico Brut Sparkling (Vino Spumante)

Description: Spring-flower, white stone-fruit, citrus and bread-crust aromas waft out of the glass. The palate is polished and smooth, featuring yellow apple, orange rind and walnut alongside a silky perlage and bright acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Travaglino 2016 Metodo Classico Cuvée 59 Sparkling (Oltrepò Pavese)

Description: Ripe red and yellow apple create a fruity nose on this wine. The palate has ripe apple mellowness and creamy roundness, as well as a crisp nature. Bubbles are lively and this dry wine presents a harmonious whole.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Vignerons de Mancey NV Brut Réserve  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: Delicate scents recalling saline, botanical herb and a the barest whiff of citrus form the subtle nose. On the dry, racy palate, brisk acidity and a lively perlage accompany ripe yellow apple, unsweetened lemon drop and a hint of hazelnut.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa 2015 Emozione Brut  (Franciacorta)

Description: A crisp, refreshing wine, this is full of citrus flavors as well as delicious floral apples and acidity. The wine has a light minerality that adds texture to its freshness. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Kompassus 2016 Blanc Brut Sparkling (Bairrada)

Description: Creamy, mellow autolysis on this wine's nose suggests bread and bread crust. Just as mellow, the palate buffers its freshness on the rich, fruity mellowness of ripe apple. The bubbles froth slightly, creating liveliness all the way to the dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Moingeon NV Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: Creamy, mellow autolysis on this wine's nose suggests bread and bread crust. Just as mellow, the palate buffers its freshness on the rich, fruity mellowness of ripe apple. The bubbles froth slightly, creating liveliness all the way to the dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Moingeon NV Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: Aged for three years on its lees before disgorgement, this wine has developed an attractive toasty character that underlines its floral, fruity character. It is a finely wrought wine, ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Designation: Marquês de Marialva Cuvée Extra Bruto
Name: Adega de Cantanhede 2012 Marquês de Marialva Cuvée Extra Bruto Sparkling (Bairrada)

Description: Fresh and refined, this bright sparkler opens with aromas of graphite, dried herb and alpine wild flower. A blend of Chardonnay and Pinot Nero, it offers ripe white stone fruit, pink grapefruit and a hint of brioche. Racy acidity and a polished, vibrant perlage provide the setting.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Altemasi NV Rosé Brut Sparkling (Trento)

Description: A crisp, refreshing wine, this is full of citrus flavors as well as delicious floral apples and acidity. The wine has a light minerality that adds texture to its freshness. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Kompassus 2016 Blanc Brut Sparkling (Bairrada)

Description: A sparkling wine region south of the Douro Valley is the source of this wine. Based mainly on a blend of Touriga Nacional and Malvasia it is a perfumed, softly textured wine, with attractive clean apple and peach flavors. With its touch of maturity, it is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Casca Wines 2014 Altitude Brut Sparkling (Távora-Varosa)

Description: Aromas of mature stone fruit, bread crust, orange liqueur and cedar form the nose. On the subtle palate, an elegant perlage accompanies mature golden apple, orange rind and candied lemon drop before a bitter-walnut close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ricci Curbastro 2009 Museum Release Extra Brut  (Franciacorta)

Description: Cream, yeast and lemon form a perfect trinity on this wine's vivid nose. The fresh palate is lively with bubbles, rounded with bready yeastiness and comes with a gentle texture. It is dry, appetizing and refreshing on the finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Labouré-Gontard NV Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: Aromas of mature stone fruit, bread crust, orange liqueur and cedar form the nose. On the subtle palate, an elegant perlage accompanies mature golden apple, orange rind and candied lemon drop before a bitter-walnut close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ricci Curbastro 2009 Museum Release Extra Brut  (Franciacorta)

Description: A subtle hint of vanilla clings to notes of warm brioche on this wine's rounded nose. The palate sweeps up this roundness in a generous embrace with concentration and freshness. Bubbles froth with liveliness, countering the autolytic roundness. The appetizing finish is dry.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Louis Bouillot NV Grande Réserve Perle des Vignes  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: A shy nose on this wine gives just slight aromas of yeast. The palate also has this yeastiness that caresses the light green and yellow-apple flavors. The foam is fine and gentle. This understated wine is altogether elegant and beautifully dry.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Louis Bouillot NV Perle de Nuit  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: A bright, lithe note of citrus on this wine's nose almost has a floral quality. The palate is light, citrus-scented and bright, but has a smooth core of creamy richness. This combination of different elements offers enduring appeal.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Louis Bouillot NV Perle d'Ivoire  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: A creamy nose on this wine reveals hints of shortbread and lemon, which carry over onto the palate. Rounded but fresh, the body displays a lovely balance between fruit and yeastiness. This harmonious wine is dry and refreshing on the finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Maison Chanzy NV Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: Bread-crust and red-berry aromas follow over to the tangy palate along with notes of candied citrus zest and a dollop of vanilla. Fresh acidity and a persistent perlage provide the background.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Medici Ermete NV Uspanique Rosé Brut Metodo Classico Sparkling (Vino Spumante)

Description: Made from 53% Chardonnay, 39% Pinot Noir, 6% Pinot Blanc and 2% of an aged reserve blend, this wine has great pink color and is dry, fresh and fruity. Strawberry, raspberry and tangerine wrap around crisp acidity and a lasting opulence that remains balanced and bright.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Piper Sonoma NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Sonoma County)

Description: In this wine, notes of Red Declicious apple come clothed in a berryish, fruity guise. The smooth, rounded palate also homes in on Red Delicious ripeness, layering rich fruit onto berry charm and citrus brightness. This wine is easy, generous, bold and fruity, with a dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Bailly-Lapierre NV Rosé Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: An initial whiff of rye bread on the nose of this wine comes with saltiness that's taken over by fruitier, riper Mirabelle plum. The palate unites these notions in one smooth, frothy, fresh but rounded package. Fine and smooth, the foam add further charm to this rounded richness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave L'Aurance NV Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: Aged for two years on lees, this ripe, mature wine is showing a fine nutty character while preserving acidity and a tangy citrus flavor. With its rounded aftertaste, the wine is at the cusp between freshness and maturity. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Designation: Marquês de Marialva Bical & Arinto Reserva
Name: Adega de Cantanhede 2015 Marquês de Marialva Bical & Arinto Reserva Sparkling (Bairrada)

Description: Aromas of white spring flower and white stone fruit form the subtle nose. The vibrant, linear palate offers bread crust, orange rind and ripe yellow apple alongside firm acidity and a lively perlage. It closes on a note of bitter walnut.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello Bonomi 2011 Cru Perdu Millesimato  (Franciacorta)

Description: This is a dry, refreshing sparkling wine made with 43% Sauvignon Blanc, 43% Chardonnay and 14% Sémillon. Simple stone fruit and pineapple meet a flinty like stoniness that adds texture and grip, with lasting lemon candy on the finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Erosion NV Sparkler Machine Sparkling (Napa Valley)

Description: Yeasty creaminess and a touch of ripe apple define this wine's nose, hinting at generosity. The palate is fresh but mellow, with fine foam underlining the essential smoothness and gentleness. Dry and smooth, the finish combines richness and freshness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Francois Gleisweiler NV Rosé Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: Ripe notes of yellow apple on this wine's nose have a zippy touch of lime. The palate also combines richness and liveliness, energized by frothy bubbles. Underneath it all, saltiness entices you to sip again and again.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Parigot & Richard NV Origines Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: With a richness of nutty brioche, this warm, winning wine is dry and structured, with a depth of oak, baked lemon and high-toned acidity. Floral aromatics adorn it further.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Sosie 2018 Brut Nature First Things First Sparkling (Sonoma County)

Description: A hint of candy floss and peardrop mingles with ripe, mellow apple notes on this wine's nose. The palate adds a yeasty, creamy texture and zestiness that makes this wine rather moreish and enticing. On the finish, it's dry and wonderfully fresh.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Pierre André NV Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: Subtle aromas on the nose of this wine include yeast, citrus and a touch of red apple. The palate has a gently phenolic texture reminiscent of citrus pith, which sits well with the yeasty undertone and the rounded but fresh apple fruit. The finish is dry and smooth.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Louis Bouillot NV Rosé Perle d'Aurore  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: Just a hint of freshly squeezed lemon appears on this wine's shy nose. The palate presents a fuller picture of subtle creaminess, light body and frothy, easy foam that makes this an enlivening, dry aperitif.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Louis Picamelot NV Les Terroirs Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Appellation: Crémant de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: Citrus and crisp green-apple fruits give this wine an attractive cool character. Acidity, tangy orange-zest flavors and floral character come together well. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Gratien et Meyer NV Brut Sparkling (Crémant de Loire)

Description: Fruity aromas of green and yellow apple dominate this wine's nose. The slender palate also brims with bright apple while frothy bubbles enhance both freshness and fruit. It's a lively sparkler, with a dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: La Maison du Crémant NV Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: Buttery creaminess is the chief notion on this wine's rounded nose. The palate counters this richness with apple freshness. Although the bubbles are almost creamy, that butteriness sets the tone all the way to the dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Pascal Bouchard NV Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: Vivid notes of ripe, red apple come with enticing creaminess on the nose of this wine. The bubbles on the slender palate are frothy and lively, carrying more of that fresh apple fruit. It is rounded, dry but beautifully fresh on the finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
