Name: Paul Chollet NV Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: Subtle, lemony creaminess spreads from the glass. The palate of this wine comes in with frothy foam and slender freshness that is bedded in a slightly chalky, gentle texture. Lemony brightness marks the dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Victorine de Chastenay 2014 Extra Brut Milléseimé  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: A bright, fruity wine, this has a lively mousse and crisp apple and pear acidity. The Arinto gives its signature freshness and tight texture. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Quinta da Lapa 2016 Brut Nature Reserva Sparkling (Tejo)

Description: Hawthorn, pear and hazelnut aromas lift out of the glass along with a whiff of medicinal herb. The bright, lively palate offers mature yellow apple and bread crust set against a vigorous perlage.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Antica Fratta 2015 Essence Brut  (Franciacorta)

Description: Ripe apple, almost with a hint of candied apple, and citrus feature on the fresh, fruity nose of this wine. The palate retains the apple notes and adds creamy, fruity richness. Everything is supplemented by fine, smooth bubbles. The finish is dry and fresh.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: La Burgondie NV Brut Réserve  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: Bright lemon on the nose of this wine has a floral overtone of summer blossom. The body comes in with lightness and a fine, creamy foam that enhances the feeling of weightlessness. This wine is fresh and easy, with a yeasty backdrop that gives substance to the fizz. The finish is dry and appetizing.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Simonnet-Febvre NV Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: The creamy richness Red Delicious apple flesh immediately fills this wine's nose with mellowness. The palate presents that ripe but dry and smooth flavor, too. Frothy bubbles add liveliness and freshness to the rounded wine and its dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Vignerons de Mancey NV Rosé Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Appellation: San Diego County, South Coast, California, US
Description: Sparkling Mourvèdre is uncommon, at least in California, but this is a solid showing of its potential. Pale pink in the glass, the wine combines watermelon aromas with a steely, metallic tone. Flavors of dried cranberry and rose petal converge with that tinny minerality on the palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Hungry Hawk 2019 Brut Rosé Sparkling (San Diego County)

Appellation: San Diego County, South Coast, California, US
Description: Sparkling Mourvèdre is uncommon, at least in California, but this is a solid showing of its potential. Pale pink in the glass, the wine combines watermelon aromas with a steely, metallic tone. Flavors of dried cranberry and rose petal converge with that tinny minerality on the palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Hungry Hawk 2019 Brut Rosé Sparkling (San Diego County)

Description: Fresh red apple and lemon zest make for an appealing aromatic duo on this wine's nose. The palate adds a yeasty, bready tone and a slightly pithy texture, complementing the rounded fruit and making for smoothness and glinting freshness. It is dry and smooth on the finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Bailly-Lapierre NV Réserve  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: This vibrant sparkler has a subtle nose suggesting bread crust and orange zest. The aromas carry over to the racy palate along with toasted nut and mature yellow-apple skin while a lively perlage and brisk acidity keep it vibrant.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ricci Curbastro 2015 Extra Brut  (Franciacorta)

Description: Perfumes of ripe, juicy strawberries and strawberry candy float from the glass. The palate of this wine is rounded and fresh while the bubbles enhance that lovely strawberry note all the way to the dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Levert Frères 2018 Rosé Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: Touriga Nacional and Aragonez make a fresh, red-currant flavored wine. Its crisp texture and clean, bright acidity are just right, giving a wine that is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Quinta da Lapa 2018 Nana Rosé Bruto Sparkling (Tejo)

Description: Produced from Pinot Blanc, this crisp and ripe sparkling wine is perfumed, lit by citrus fruits and rounded by creamed apples. A light texture holds all this fruitiness together. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Bernard Magrez NV Ariela Bruto Sparkling (Portugal)

Description: A finely beaded texture and rich mouthfeel are filled in with light cherry and plum notes in this well-balanced, polished wine. Freshness and softness are its hallmarks.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Weibel Family 2019 Archgate Rose Pinot Noir Sparkling (California)

Description: Touriga Nacional and Aragonez make a fresh, red-currant flavored wine. Its crisp texture and clean, bright acidity are just right, giving a wine that is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Quinta da Lapa 2018 Nana Rosé Bruto Sparkling (Tejo)

Description: Perfumes of ripe, juicy strawberries and strawberry candy float from the glass. The palate of this wine is rounded and fresh while the bubbles enhance that lovely strawberry note all the way to the dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Levert Frères 2018 Rosé Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: Notes of Red Delicious apple on the nose of this wine have a leafy overtone of elderberry. The mellow palate has an earthy tinge, hinting at chalk but also wanting a little more definition. Rounded and smooth, the body comes to a dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: JCB NV No. 21 Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: A hint of wet earth comes with a sense of citrus coolness on this wine's nose. The rounded palate has more of that earthy edge that slowly morphs into citrus pithiness and texture. There is creamy foam and a sense of ripe freshness. The finish is dry.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Champliau NV Rosé Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: Slight notes of red and yellow apple come with tender creaminess on this wine's nose. The slender palate also has lively apple notes and an easy, slightly creamy foam that makes this wine fresh and smooth. It is dry on the finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Levert Frères 2018 Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: Ripe red and green apple notes abound on this wine's fresh nose. The palate offers exuberant foaminess, more apple notes, freshness and slenderness. This wine is easy, dry, fruity and lively.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Moillard 2017 Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: Aromas of bread crust and orange liqueur carry over to the palate along with mature yellow-apple skin and walnut. Fresh acidity and a vibrant perlage provide the invigorating setting.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bellavista 2015 Teatro alla Scala Brut  (Franciacorta)

Description: Slight notes of red and yellow apple come with tender creaminess on this wine's nose. The slender palate also has lively apple notes and an easy, slightly creamy foam that makes this wine fresh and smooth. It is dry on the finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Levert Frères 2018 Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: This sparkling wine, produced from white grapes, is crisp and fruity. Its light apple and pear flavors are zesty with bright acidity shining through the soft texture. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Magnum Carlos Lucas Vinhos 2015 Ribeiro Santo Bruto Sparkling (Dão)

Description: A hint of lemon and slight whiff of strawberry are shy on this wine's nose. The bright palate is alive with frothy bubbles that make this both rounded and fresh. The finish is dry and appetizing.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Albert Bichot NV Rosé Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: Fresh green-apple notes abound on this wine's fruity nose. The palate shows similar verve, bubbling with liveliness on the slender body. It's dry and apple-scented on the finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Champliau NV Brut Authentique  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: Fruity notes of white currant, yellow apple and Mirabelle plum are tender on this wine's nose. The palate is light, easy and frothy, wrapping its freshness in fruitiness. It finishes dry and fresh.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Marie André NV Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: Notes of ripe, green apple have hints of lime peel and pear drop on this wine's nose. Fruitiness is also evident on the palate where fine fizz adds creaminess to the freshness. The finish is dry and bright.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: François Martenot 2018 Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: A strawberry candy note abounds on the vivid and fresh nose of this wine. The palate adds ripe, red apple freshness as well as frothy but creamy foam, making this an easy, joyous, fruity and dry sparkler.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: La Burgondie NV Rosé Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: A hint of cotton candy is all that shows on this wine's nose. The palate has creaminess, freshness and fine bubbles but could do with more fruit precision. Nonetheless, this is refreshing and beautifully dry.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Moillard 2017 Rosé Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Appellation: Crémant de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: Lightly textured and with crisp fruitiness, this is a pale-colored, elegant rosé. With its cool acidity and perfumed aftertaste, the bottling is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Gratien et Meyer NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Crémant de Loire)

Description: Aromas of bread crust and orange liqueur are front and center. The aromas follow over to palate, along with mature yellow apple and toasted walnut alongside a lively perlage. Bright acidity keeps it tangy.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bellavista 2015 Rosé Brut  (Franciacorta)

Description: Aromas of walnut and orange rind follow over to the palate, along with bread crust and hints of sour cherry. An invigorating perlage and bright acidity provide the backdrop.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Monte Rossa NV Flamingo Rosé Brut  (Franciacorta)

Description: In this wine, initial flinty reduction blows off and reveals fresh apple and lemon notes. The frothy palate is easy and light, giving a sense of ripe, yellow-apple flesh and rounded freshness. Bubbles are lively and the finish is dry.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine des Terres de Velle NV Les Bulles Extra Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: Aromas suggesting toasted bread crust, underbrush and hazelnut form the nose. On the racy palate, notes of orange-flavored liqueur and vanilla accompany pomegranate and apple. Firm acidity and an invigorating perlage provide the backdrop.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa 2014 Bokè Rosé Brut  (Franciacorta)

Description: Notes of fresh pear, lemon and green apple unite into fruity freshness on this wine's nose. Just as fruity, the palate is also light and foamy. The finish is dry and fresh.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Victorine de Chastenay NV Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: Bical and Arinto produce a spicy, lightly peppered wine. Its white fruits and acidity shine brightly through the hints of mineral texture. The wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Designation: Marquês de Marialva Blanc de Blancs Bruto
Name: Adega de Cantanhede NV Marquês de Marialva Blanc de Blancs Bruto Sparkling (Beira Atlantico)

Description: A lifted hint of something akin to pine presents itself first on this wine's fresh nose. On the palate, a rye-bread notion of autolysis adds yeasty mellowness to this fresh, smooth, dry wine.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Francois Gleisweiler NV Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

Description: A soft, fruity wine, this has a creamy mousse and a light texture from the tannins of the Baga grape. Its acidity is now softening, giving a hint of toast in its place. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Designation: Marquês de Marialva Baga Blanc de Noirs Bruto
Name: Adega de Cantanhede 2016 Marquês de Marialva Baga Blanc de Noirs Bruto Sparkling (Bairrada)

Description: The local red grape, Baga, lends a floral as well as a structured character to this wine. Packed with red fruits, red currants and raspberries, the wine is crisply textured and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Designation: Marquês de Marialva Baga Rosé Bruto
Name: Adega de Cantanhede NV Marquês de Marialva Baga Rosé Bruto Sparkling (Beira Atlantico)

Description: This invigorating sparkler opens with subdued aromas suggesting toasted nut, bread crust, coconut and citrus. The aromas carry over to the dry, linear palate along with mature yellow apple and bitter walnut skin set against a bracing perlage.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello Bonomi 2012 Dosaggio Zero  (Franciacorta)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: A light copper color and rather advanced nut and dried fruit flavors give this wine a mature profile that's interesting to taste. It's broad and rather soft in texture, dry and a bit lean on the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Migration NV Brut Rose Sparkling (North Coast)

Appellation: Crémant de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: This lively wine has attractive citrus flavors and bright acidity. Crisp pear fruitiness goes with the tangy texture and squeeze of lemon at the end. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: De Valloie NV Paramour Brut Sparkling (Crémant de Loire)

Description: This is an attractive, fruity wine, crisp with acidity that balances the medium-sweet flavors. Bright, lively, it is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2018 Plexus Sparkling (Tejo)

Description: Crisp apple and dried herb aromas lead to sweet, broad floral and pistachio flavors in this frothy, fruity wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Scotto Family Cellars NV Proscotto Semi-Sweet Bubbles Sparkling (California)

Description: Produced from 100% Alicante Bouschet, this red sparkling wine shows slight tannins and plenty of spice. It is dry, unlike the others in this range of sparkling wines and will be a fine food wine. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2018 Plexus Tinto Sparkling (Tejo)

Description: Softly textured and gently fruity, this is lightly red-currant flavored wine. It is somewhat unfocused, with a simple aftertaste. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: De Valloie NV Paramour Rosé Brut  (Saumur)

Description: A medium-sweet pink wine, this blends Castelão and Tinta Roriz, which has the benefit of at least being clean and fruity. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2018 Plexus Rose Sparkling (Tejo)

Appellation: Crémant de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: This soft, creamy wine has a soapy texture that does no justice to green-apple flavors. It is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Veuve Amiot NV Pol Clement Brut Sparkling (Crémant de Loire)

Description: Onion and garlic aromas are not appealing, while this Chilean sparkler from the Italian Zonin family feels flat as a board, with no lift. Mustard and bitter green flavors are barely acceptable.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Dos Almas NV Brut Sparkling (Casablanca Valley)

Description: This famed Champagne comes from one of the steepest vineyards in the whole region, facing across the Marne river. With a blend of 71% Pinot Noir and 29% Chardonnay, the densely textured wine shows great richness, a magnificent sense of place and structure. This is a very fine wine, a monument among Champagnes, one that will age for many more years. Drink through 2030.                      Roger Voss
Name: Philipponnat 2010 Clos des Goisses Extra Brut  (Champagne)

Description: As the first 100% biodynamic Cristal, entirely from Roederer-owned vineyards, this is an important milestone. This latest incarnation is a great Champagne with its density, elegance and poise. Still impressively young, the wine is taut, tightly wound and textured. At the same time, it has pure, ripe white and citrus fruits that are perfumed, and an important part of this wine's long-term future. Drink at the earliest from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Louis Roederer 2012 Cristal Brut  (Champagne)

Description: Aged for 10 years on its lees before disgorgement, this impressive vintage Champagne is perfectly mature. The touches of maturity have moved the wine into richness, the fruit and acidity filling out and deepening. This is a great Champagne from a great vintage, ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Charles Heidsieck 2008 Brut Millésimé  (Champagne)

Description: Years in the making, this is the first fully biodynamic Cristal rosé. The very fine 2012 vintage is a good starting point for this new era. The Champagne is just right, beautifully rich and showing some maturity while also having tension and crispness from the golden-apple and spice flavors. The wine could be drunk now but its future is assured. Organic and biodynamic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Louis Roederer 2012 Cristal Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

Description: The balance between maturity and fruit in this Champagne is exemplary. It gives both ripeness to the red-currant fruits and a fine nutty richness that meld together seamlessly. This is a beautiful wine, perfectly ready to drink but also sure to age well in bottle.                      Roger Voss
Name: Krug NV Rosé 24ème Edition Brut  (Champagne)

Description: This mature wine is finely structured with a delicate mousse and forward toast and brioche flavors. At the same time, the texture and the white fruits are still there, creating a magnificent Champagne with texture and richness in a taut, tight package. Drink the wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Henriot 2006 Cuvée Hemera Brut  (Champagne)

Description: As always, this Pinot Noir-dominated Champagne is a great wine. In this vintage, it is fuller than usual, perhaps less structured—a true reflection of the vintage. Like all releases of this cuvée, the wine will age magnificently. Drink now or hold for at least 10 years to get full maturity.                      Roger Voss
Name: Pol Roger 2009 Cuvée Sir Winston Churchill Brut  (Champagne)

Description: Still young for a wine of this caliber, this rich Champagne has an immense future ahead of it. The freshness of the wine will mature into the rich toastiness that is such a hallmark of this brand. Oak fermentation and aging have added to the great promise of this fine wine. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Bollinger 2012 La Grande Année Brut  (Champagne)

Description: Pale in color, but rich in texture and fruit, this wonderfully mature rosé is structured from 70% Pinot Noir in the blend. There is a nutty character to the wine that springs from the wine's richness and the mellifluous aging of the red fruits. Drink this very fine Champagne now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Charles Heidsieck 2005 Rosé Millésimé Brut  (Champagne)

Description: The new release of this producer's prestige cuvée comes in its usual beautifully sculpted bottle. The Champagne, from a great vintage in the region, is just approaching maturity still showing minerality from the high amount of Chardonnay in the blend. Nutty flavors are creeping in, keeping the great texture adding complexity. Drink this very fine wine now although it will also age further.                      Roger Voss
Name: Rare Champagne 2008 Brut  (Champagne)

Description: With a slight preponderance of Pinot Noir in the blend, this wine is rich and impressive. It is still young, with a crisp edge that makes the fruit shine. Apple and citrus flavors are integrated into a mineral vein. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Veuve Clicquot Ponsardin 2012 La Grande Dame Brut  (Champagne)

Description: In line with the producer's practice of numbering each bottling of its flagship Grande Cuvée, this is the latest release. Following the house style, there is some marvelously impressive Pinot Noir in this rich, full blend. That gives the Champagne its luxurious feel, contrasting with the tension from the dryness and minerality. This bottling, which shows maturity, is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Krug NV Grande Cuvée 168ème Edition  (Champagne)

Description: This grand cru wine is named in celebration of the date of the Philipponnat family's arrival in the village of Aÿ. It is a mature blend of 70% Pinot Noir with Chardonnay, proportions that are typical of this producer on the Montagne de Reims. Rich, lightly toasty with green-apple and pear flavors, the wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Philipponnat 2012 Cuvée 1522 Grand Cru Extra Brut  (Champagne)

Description: The result of a joint venture between Rhône winemaker Michel Chapoutier and this Aube-based cooperative, this Champagne is impressively rich. Wood aging and the half-and-half blend of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay have now come beautifully together in this elegant wine. Its acidity and tight texture are signs that there is plenty of potential even after nine years. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Devaux 2011 Cuvée Sténopé  (Champagne)

Description: The new release of this iconic Champagne shows its richness to perfection. The floral aromas lead to a wine that has weight and density as well as a balance that encompasses ripe fruits that have now matured to reveal nuttiness, toast and a tight salinity at the end. Drink through 2028.                      Roger Voss
Name: Moët & Chandon 2010 Dom Pérignon Vintage Brut  (Champagne)

Description: Some bottles from every release by this producer are kept back for later disgorgement, giving longer aging on the lees. This Champagne, based on the 2010 vintage has great richness and intensity and dryness that is balanced by the aging flavors. Drink this impressive wine now although it will also age further.                      Roger Voss
Designation: Cuvée No. 738 Dégorgement Tardive Extra Brut
Name: Jacquesson et Fils NV Cuvée No. 738 Dégorgement Tardive Extra Brut  (Champagne)

Description: A blend of as many as 100 different parcels, this newly-created cuvée has depth and richness both from the high proportion of Pinot Noir and the 45% of reserve wines. The wine's ripe green-plum and fine perfumed character give touches of coming, full maturity. Drink this very fine bottling now but also age for several years.                      Roger Voss
Name: Lanson NV Le Black Réserve Brut  (Champagne)

Description: Bread dough, white stone fruit, wild herb and a whiff of citrus zest mingle with balsamic notes on this fragrant sparkler. It's delicious and loaded with finesse, delivering juicy sour cherry, pomegranate, baking spice and grilled herb alongside a silky mousse. Bright acidity keeps it fresh and balanced.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ferghettina 2016 Rosé  (Franciacorta)

Description: The Roederer style has become drier as the fruit has become riper and this finely balanced Champagne is an excellent example. Taut and textured, with great freshness allied to the mineral and fruit tones, this wine just hints at tannins as it moves towards maturity. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Louis Roederer 2014 Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This wonderfully elegant and subtle wine is well-suited for a special occasion now through at least 2025. It offers complex and intriguing aromas of toast, ginger and raspberry followed by a light but creamy mouthfeel buoyed by minute, persistent bubbles.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Roederer Estate 2012 L'Ermitage Estate Bottled Brut Rosé Sparkling (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A panoply of subtle aromas and delicate flavors wrapped in a silky, slightly crisp texture give this medium-bodied wine a great sense of elegance. Fresh ginger, biscuits, toasted almonds and mild cherry nuances fill the palate. Best through 2025.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Roederer Estate 2013 L'Ermitage Estate Bottled Brut Sparkling (Anderson Valley)

Description: Creamy, delicious and loaded with silky finesse as well as depth, this gorgeous sparkler opens with refined aromas reminiscent of freshly made bread dough, woodland berry, pressed rose, chamomile and baking spice. The dry savory palate delivers juicy strawberry, pomegranate, white pepper, crushed herb and a hint of pastry cream alongside vibrant acidity. A silky continuous perlage lends even more elegance and keeps you coming back for more. Drink through 2028.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Maso Martis 2016 Rosé Extra Brut Sparkling (Trento)

Description: This producer's deluxe cuvée is dominated by Chardonnay. Wood fermentation has brought spice to Champagne's rounded, rich fruits, hints of peach and tight minerality. This fine wine is mature enough to drink but it also has a great future. Perfect maturity should be from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Alfred Gratien 2013 Cuvée Paradis Brut  (Champagne)

Description: Now richly mature, this serious, ripe Champagne is ready to drink. Hints of toastiness come through as well as the taut texture and full acidity that balance the wine's generous fruit. Drink this beautiful wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Mailly Grand Cru 2011 Les Echansons Brut  (Champagne)

Description: A blend from seven grand crus across the Montagne de Reims and Côte des Blancs, this is dry in the classic Ayala style. Its freshness has been tempered by bottle aging although it is by no means mature and still has taught acidity. The mineral texture of the Chardonnay is balanced by the riper structure of the Pinot Noir in an impressive wine. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Ayala 2007 No 7 Brut  (Champagne)

Description: Heady aromas of white spring flower, white stone fruit and bread crust form the inviting nose on this elegant, focused sparkler. Made with Chardonnay and Pinot Nero, the bone-dry linear palate delivers mature yellow apple, white peach and unsweetened lemon drop alongside a silky perlage of small, continuous bubbles. Fresh acidity keeps it balanced. Thoroughly delicious.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fratelli Berlucchi 2015 Freccianera Nature  (Franciacorta)

Description: As a rich dense Champagne that manages to bring in so many complex flavors, this is impressive. It has tense acidity, along with fresh red fruits that are just beginning to deepen and concentrate. They are balanced with the minerality and acidity as well as the weight of the Pinot Noir. Begin to drink this beautiful wine now although it has many years ahead of it.                      Roger Voss
Name: Bollinger 2012 La Grande Année Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

Description: The partial wood aging has brought both complexity and rich softness to this fine blend of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay. Its fine fruits are gently maturing into a ripe, rounded character that will stay for many years. This is a fine wine that will be ready from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Soutiran 2012 Grand Cru Millesimé Brut  (Champagne)

Description: Aged for at least 12 years after bottling, this Champagne is richly textured, showing mature fruitiness, touches of aging from the brioche flavors and an elegant, ripe aftertaste. Drink this wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Gosset NV Cuvée 12 Brut  (Champagne)

Description: A selection from the best lots in the producer's cellar, this limited-release Champagne is mainly aged in wood and spends extended time on the lees. It is a rich, full-bodied wine that shows balanced fruit and a hints of age. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Castelnau NV Hors Catégorie Brut  (Champagne)

Description: A hint of Golden Delicious apple appears on the nose first, followed by a sense of salty lemon. The palate then explodes with creamy foam into a vision of apple freshness. Tiny pinprick bubbles deliver notions of that salty depth, flirting with short crust pastry, oystershell and chalk in the process. The bone-dry, fresh briskness is a promise of timeless elegance. This is lovely, moreish and refreshing now but will evolve. Drink now–2030.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Ebner-Ebenauer 2013 Blanc de Blancs Brut Nature Sparkling (Österreichischer Sekt)

Description: From one of the best vintages of this century, this Champagne is impressive. Its richness is balanced by the now mature minerality of the Chardonnay. The wine has developed a nutty character to balance the fragrance and brightness of the great fruitiness. Drink this wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Infinite Eight 2004 Millésimé Brut  (Champagne)

Description: From grand and premier cru vineyards, this Champagne comes from a good but not great vintage. That explains its precocious maturity, its fine toastiness and its great balance between a steely texture and nutty flavors. It is a delicious wine now, very much ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Lanson 2009 Le Vintage Brut  (Champagne)

Description: Made from 53% Chardonnay, 43% Pinot Noir and 4% Pinot Meunier, and sur lies aged for five years, this wine is fresh, focused and sophisticated. High-toned acidity emphasizes flavors of lime, wet stone and strawberry, with a finishing touch of Meyer lemon scone.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Domaine Chandon NV Etoile Rosé Sparkling (Carneros)

Description: This Champagne has the necessary bottle age for its bone-dry character to be softened and given great complexity. The wine's freshness and apple fruits are palpable but they have attractive nutty hints that make this fine bottling ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Laurent-Perrier NV Ultra Brut Brut Nature  (Champagne)

Description: Launched in 2019, this is a blend of the three Champagne grapes in equal proportion along with 37% reserve wine. The combination gives a Champagne that is mature and beautifully balanced, ripe with creamed apples while also having a toasty aspect. The bottling is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Chanoine NV Tsarine Cuvée Orium Brut  (Champagne)

Description: This lovely sparkler combines 70% Pinot Noir and 30% Pinot Meunier. It was given 18 months in neutral oak and three years for the wine to remain on the lees. Classically structured, it offers nuances of oyster shell, wild strawberry and lemon, while beig high-toned, racy and fresh.                      Virginie Boone
Name: POE 2015 Rosé Sparkling (Sonoma County)

Description: This is a beautifully mature bottling, poised between great fruits and roundness that comes from partial aging in wood. The blend is dominated by the 70% Chardonnay that gives a mineral edge to the creamy apple flavors. Drink this wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Le Brun de Neuville NV La Croisée des Chemins  (Champagne)

Description: Six years on the lees before disgorgement has produced a Champagne that is just approaching perfect maturity. It is dry but that dryness has now softened with the developing nuttiness. This wine, developed as a collaboration with designer Philippe Starck, is now ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Louis Roederer 2012 Philippe Starck Brut Nature  (Champagne)

Description: Definitely dry, this Champagne is crisp, nervy, textured and needing further bottle age. The wine has enormous potential richness from the intensity and structure of the grand cru fruit of Verzenay. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Designation: Terre de Verzenay Grand Cru Extra Brut
Name: Champagne Sabine Godmé NV Terre de Verzenay Grand Cru Extra Brut  (Champagne)

Description: All grand cru grapes from Ambonnay on the eastern flank of the Montagne de Reims, this Champagne is impressively rich and beautifully balanced. The freshness of the white-fruit flavors is tempered by the softening effects of toastiness to give a great wine that is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Soutiran NV Collection Privée Grand Cru Brut  (Champagne)

Description: From grand cru vineyards on the Montagne de Reims, this fine, now mature, Champagne is rich with ripe citrus, pear and peach flavors, generously structured and poised between toastiness and fresh, crisp fruits. Drink this wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Henriet-Bazin 2012 Eusèbe Grand Cru Brut  (Champagne)

Description: From a Lanson-owned vineyard, the Domaine de la Malmaison, this Champagne is beautifully balanced with steely acidity as well as a structure that gives the bottling aging potential. The wine's white- and yellow-fruit flavors are lifted by the pure line of acidity at the end. Drink now. Organic and biodynamic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Lanson NV Green Label Bio-Organic  (Champagne)

Description: Aged in wood, this is the latest iteration of the producer's nonvintage cuvée based on the 2015 vintage It is impressive in its white-fruit richness that is perfectly balanced by intense acidity. Bottle aging has added to the Champagne's complexity. This is a fine wine that is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Designation: Cuvée No. 743 Grand Vin Extra Brut
Name: Jacquesson et Fils NV Cuvée No. 743 Grand Vin Extra Brut  (Champagne)

Description: This great rosé combines texture with bright fruit and a bit of age. It is poised between a ripe dosage and a crisp texture, with red fruits and toastiness marking the flavors. It is a fine bottling to enjoy now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Laurent-Perrier NV Cuvée Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

Description: With a dry, floral nose, this lovely sparkler is a blend of 68% Flora, 31% Chardonnay and 1% Pinot Noir, with 15% barrel fermentation. Sweet, unctuous layers of peach, pear and vanilla biscuit are lifted by a balance of fresh acidity and underlying structure, making for a cohesive experience on the palate.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Schramsberg 2016 Crémant Méthode Champenoise Demi-Sec Sparkling (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The first-ever release of sparkling wine from Adelsheim leaves one wishing for more—much, much more. Done in the méthode Champenoise style, and aged en tirage for almost six years, this tart, tight, crisp, fresh, dense and detailed wine opens with green apple and apple skin fruit. It breathes into life with hints of brioche. The overall composition and complexity beg for cellaring. Drink 2025–2040.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Adelsheim 2014 Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Willamette Valley)

Description: A sophisticated wine (a blend of the three Champagne grapes), this is a new release from this producer. It is dry, but the ripeness of the fruit offers a fine balance with the crisp, green-apple texture. Let this bottling age a few months and drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Billecart-Salmon NV Brut Nature  (Champagne)

Description: A sophisticated wine (a blend of the three Champagne grapes), this is a new release from this producer. It is dry, but the ripeness of the fruit offers a fine balance with the crisp, green-apple texture. Let this bottling age a few months and drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Billecart-Salmon NV Brut Nature  (Champagne)

Description: This limited-production prestige Champagne in its elegant designer frosted bottle is crisp, tight with citrus and green plums. The blend of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay in equal proportions gives a wine that is rich, steely and nervy and set for some bottle aging. Drink this bottling from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Chanoine NV Tzarina No. 1 Brut  (Champagne)

Description: The Chardonnay in this fine Champagne gives it a crisp, perfumed character that dominates with its subtle line of acidity and hints of tension and minerality. The wine can be drunk now but, because this is such a fine vintage, it could age further and will be at its peak from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Charles Orban 2008 Millésimé Brut Cuvée Spéciale  (Champagne)

Description: A lovely copper cherry shade, this lush and fruity bubbly is loaded with cherry flavors, backed with generous acidity. There's a fine bead and a framing note of lemon peel. Delicious already, it seems sure to evolve nicely over the next six to eight years.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Soter 2016 Mineral Springs Brut Rosé Sparkling (Yamhill-Carlton)

Description: From slopes around Épernay, this bone-dry Champagne is also intensely fruity. Ripe white fruits show a vibrancy and richness that contrasts with the wine's dryness. The bottling could age a little further so drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vincent d'Astrée NV Eclipse Zéro Dosage Premier Cru  (Champagne)

Description: This ripe Champagne is dominated by crisp Chardonnay. It is poised with fine fruits tht progress into a mineral, steely texture, with just a hint of nuttiness. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vollereaux 2011 Cuvée Marguerite Millésime Brut  (Champagne)

Description: This producer's nonvintage cuvée is just right. It is balanced, the ripe apple and pear flavors are laced with acidity and citrus are, giving minerality as well as structure from the 65% Pinot Noir in the blend. This Champagne is perfectly ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Philipponnat NV Royale Réserve Brut  (Champagne)

Description: This Champagne is full and fruity, with hints of maturity as well as perfumed acidity. The red-berry fruits have a light structure while showing elegance. The aftertaste dwells on fruitiness. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Philipponnat NV Royale Réserve Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

Description: In the house style with its predominance of Chardonnay in the blend, this is a Champagne now mature, with toastiness as well as almond flavors. It has a softness to it that shows age as well as a relatively high dosage. Drink this beautifully textured wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Alfred Gratien 2007 Brut Millésimé  (Champagne)

Description: A first-time bubbly from Hyland, this impresses with an old vine (1973) mix of 56% Pinot Noir and 44% Chardonnay. Floral scents mix honeysuckle and citrus, leading into a delicate, detailed palate. It continues with floral accents and tangy fruit flavors showcasing yellow and green apples, all framed with citrus. The length and precision argue for cellaring at least a few bottles over the next decade.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Hyland 2016 Méthode Champenoise Single Vineyard Sparkling (McMinnville)

Description: Another creamy, delicious offering from this fantastic estate, this opens with enticing scents of ripe, white stone fruit, bread crust and yellow spring flower. Structured and elegant, the focused palate delivers ripe pear, white peach and lemon drop before closing on a ginger note. Made from 70% Pinot Nero and 30% Chardonnay—organically grown—it boasts a vibrant, refined perlage and bright acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Maso Martis 2016 Brut Riserva Sparkling (Trento)

Description: Based on the 2015 vintage and with almost half the blend made of reserve wines, this Champagne is totally and impressively mature. It is rich, dominated by the red Pinots, textured and with structure. Drink this bone-dry wine from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: AR Lenoble NV Mag 15 Brut Nature Dosage Zéro  (Champagne)

Description: This is a new project for this the ever-expanding JCB range. With some maturity, the wine's vintage character is evident, finely judged and smoothly ready to drink. Apples and fine acidity come together in a Champagne that shows its celebratory character in a gold bottle.                      Roger Voss
Name: JCB 2010 Gala Brut  (Champagne)

Description: With 70% Grand and Premier Crus in the blend, this tight, taut and mineral textured Champagne comes mainly from fruit grown on the Côte des Blancs. It is well balanced with hints of toastiness as well as hints of salinity and great fruitiness. Drink this fine bottling now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Lanson NV Le Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Champagne)

Description: With a slightly lower percentage of Pinot Noir in the blend than is usual from this producer, the Champagne has a softer texture and riper apple and floral fruit flavors. It is a finely balanced wine with its crisp texture and great fruitiness. Drink this vintage now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Mailly Grand Cru 2012 L'Intemporelle Brut  (Champagne)

Description: The rich Pinot Noir in this blend has softened sufficiently for the creamier Chardonnay to make its mark. Together, they have formed a Champagne that is certainly dry and crisp but has now opened up to offer ripe white fruits as well. Drink this wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Mailly Grand Cru 2013 Nature Brut Nature  (Champagne)

Description: A crushed yarrow aroma on the fresh nose marks this out as an unusual sparkler. The palate comes in with rounded, ripe fruit that makes the streamlined freshness and purity at its core even more apparent. A hint of freshly cut red apple plays on the creamy midpalate, where fine foam is lively. A really elegant Sekt that is delicious now but will evolve with further bottle age. The bone-dry finish is a triumph.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Markus Huber 2017 Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Österreichischer Sekt)

Appellation: Ribbon Ridge, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The fourth vintage of this 100% Chardonnay, méthode Champenoise sparkler opens with a whiff of toast and fresh flavors of lemon pith, apple, white peach and pineapple. The clarity and rather suppressed power are apparent despite its being very recently disgorged. Tuck it away and drink after 2024.                      Paul Gregutt
Designation: Ribbon Ridge Estate Extra Brut Blanc de Blancs
Name: Pashey 2017 Ribbon Ridge Estate Extra Brut Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Ribbon Ridge)

Description: Opening with aromas of citrus zest, bread crust and balsamic notes, this classy sparkler boasts elegance and vibrancy. A blend of Chardonnay and Pinot Nero, the radiant palate delivers yellow apple, pear, orange zest and toasted almond alongside bright acidity. A silky continuous perlage generates a polished texture and finesse.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fratelli Berlucchi 2014 Freccianera Brut  (Franciacorta)

Description: This fine vintage has produced a rich, fruity and also structured blend of half-and-half Meunier and Chardonnay. The Champagne's mineral edge is balanced by its great fruitiness and taut edge. Drink this vintage wine from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: H. Blin 2011 Vintage Brut  (Champagne)

Description: An elegant blend of organically farmed Pinot Nero and Chardonnay, this has an alluring nose offering red berry, bread dough, dried aromatic herb, ground pepper and a balsamic note. Savory and loaded with finesse, the structured palate delivers juicy strawberry, pomegranate, citrus and baking spice alongside an intriguing smoky nuance. Vibrant acidity and a silky perlage provide balance.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Barone Pizzini 2016 Rosé Extra Brut  (Franciacorta)

Description: Notes of Golden Delicious apple and rye bread crumb on the nose signal both freshness and autolytic richness. The palate then portrays salty, buttery short crust, still imbued with that apple freshness, set against yeasty texture and depth, pervaded by lemon freshness and enlivened by creamy, fine, salty foam. Gorgeous balance, wonderful freshness, great elegance. Bravo.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Bründlmayer NV Brut Reserve Sparkling (Österreichischer Sekt)

Description: Half and half Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, this is the luxury cuvée from this producer. Its toasty aromas and palate are a fine sign of a mature Champagne that has aged well in the bottle. Ripe and textured, a vinous Champagne, this is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Montaudon NV Classe M  (Champagne)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: An enticing, toasty, nutty aroma leads to crisp and complex flavors in this medium-bodied wine that is braced by good acidity and a fine bead of bubbles. Subtle, mature notes complement the elegant texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Roederer Estate NV Brut Sparkling (Anderson Valley)

Description: Heading towards dryness, this pale-colored rosé Champagne is also rich. Its red-currant and crisp apple flavors are laced with citrus zest to give a wine that has fine balance. This bottling is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Gosset NV Brut Grand Rosé  (Champagne)

Description: This bone-dry Champagne comes from parcels across the seven villages where the producer has its vineyards. As befits its name it has no dosage and just brings out the richness of the fruit in the blend which is predominantly Chardonnay. This is a beautifully structured, tight, mineral wine that has some bottle age and a touch of softness from wood aging. Drink the bottling now.                      Roger Voss
Name: J. M. Sélèque NV Solessence Nature 7 Villages Brut Nature  (Champagne)

Description: This bone-dry Champagne, conceived by Roederer and designer Philippe Starck, shows fine maturity that balances the tight texture that still comes from the freshest fruits. With this balance and poise this beautiful wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Louis Roederer 2012 Philippe Starck Brut Nature Rosé  (Champagne)

Description: Half and half Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, this is the luxury cuvée from this producer. Its toasty aromas and palate are a fine sign of a mature Champagne that has aged well in the bottle. Ripe and textured, a vinous Champagne, this is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Montaudon NV Classe M  (Champagne)

Description: This is all Chardonnay and spent six years en tirage prior to being disgorged early in 2019. It's showing some extra richness and roundness as a result, yet it remains robust and fresh, with apples, Asian pear and lemon oil flavors in abundance. A suggestion of chalk takes it even closer to true Champagne.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Soter 2013 Mineral Springs Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Yamhill-Carlton)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: An enticing, toasty, nutty aroma leads to crisp and complex flavors in this medium-bodied wine that is braced by good acidity and a fine bead of bubbles. Subtle, mature notes complement the elegant texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Roederer Estate NV Brut Sparkling (Anderson Valley)

Description: This ripe Champagne is now fully mature. Its nutty character is what shows most strongly, underlining the toasty flavors while still keeping in touch of crisp acidity and citrus flavors. The wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Louise Brison 2004 Légende Millésime Brut  (Champagne)

Description: Dry, certainly, but also with the richness always associated with this producer, the Champagne is full of freshness with white fruit and a tight, mineral texture. This style demands some more bottle age, so drink this bottling from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Pol Roger NV Pure Extra Brut  (Champagne)

Description: The palest of rosés made primarily from grand cru Chardonnay grown on the Côte des Blancs, this is dry while packed with fruit and a deliciously crisp texture. The Champagne shines brilliantly and this bottling is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: AR Lenoble NV Rosé Terroirs Extra Brut  (Champagne)

Description: The palest of rosés, this is an elegant, structured wine. Its dryness is balanced by the fine apple and red-currant fruits and the strong sense of minerality. Fragrant and lightly structured, this fine bottling is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Billecart-Salmon NV Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

Description: With 10 years in its large bottle format, this Champagne is now mature. The low dosage has encouraged the wine's ripe fruits to express themselves with green-apple and spiced pear flavors that have now gained toastiness. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Canard-Duchêne 2010 Cuvée V Extra Brut Vintage  (Champagne)

Description: Considering this Champagne comes from an average vintage in the region, it has aged gracefully, keeping freshness while introducing touches of nuttiness. So the balance is good and the wine is perfect to drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Ernest Rapeneau 2007 Millésime Brut  (Champagne)

Description: With its 100% Chardonnay, this Champagne is finely textured, elegant with minerality and the freshest crispest apple flavors. It does have some weight and certainly has intensity—a satisfying, textured wine that is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Ruinart NV Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Champagne)

Description: The dramatic gold bottle and the attractive, mature Champagne inside go well together. Half-and-half Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, the wine was aged in wood that has enriched its texture. Now at its peak this wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: G.H. Martel 2010 Victoire Vintage Limited Edition Brut  (Champagne)

Description: The crisp texture from the low dosage of this Champagne has been softened by the 50% of mature reserve wines. There is plenty of tight, steely acidity, but that is balanced by the wine's hints of toast and spice. Drink the bottling now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Michel Forget NV Premier Cru Extra Brut  (Champagne)

Description: The four years on the lees before disgorgement shows in the richness of this Champagne. Nutty flavors and perfumed aromas come together in a ripe, tightly textured and mature bottling. Drink this fine wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Piper-Heidsieck NV Essentiel Cuvée Réservée Extra Brut  (Champagne)

Description: An attractive pale rosé color heralds a crisp, dry style of Champagne, ripe and now mature. Along with the structure and minerality that give the wine its shape and further potential, there is a hint of the toastiness to come. Drink the wine now, or even better, wait until 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Veuve Clicquot Ponsardin 2012 Vintage Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

Description: From the 2016 vintage and with the addition of 40% reserve wines, this very dry Champagne is pure, clean and singing with fruitiness. All three grapes show in the blend, crisp Chardonnay, structured Pinot Noir and fruity Meunier. Drink this wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: AR Lenoble NV Intense Mag 16 Extra Brut  (Champagne)

Description: This is a finely balanced Champagne, hinting at red fruits with a dry edge and great fruitiness. It has bottle age that adds an extra dimension to the wine's fruit and acidity. This bottling, with its maturity, is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Charles Heidsieck NV Rosé Réserve Brut  (Champagne)

Description: A bone-dry Champagne, with a slight preponderance of Pinot Noir in the blend, this succeeds because of the richness of its fruit and the tight texture. The bottling is young, still shockingly fresh and crisp, so wait to drink until 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Devaux NV Ultra D Extra Brut  (Champagne)

Description: As its description suggests this Champagne is dry. But the layers of ripe white-fruit flavors give a balance to the low dosage and bring out a fine texture. Drink this crisp wine with food.                      Roger Voss
Name: Forget-Brimont NV Extra Brut Premier Cru  (Champagne)

Description: Aromas of mature white stone fruit, bread crust, eucalyptus and toasted nut waft out of the glass. Linear and bone dry, the palate offers mature yellow apple, dried orange slice and roasted hazelnut alongside a refined perlage and firm acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fratelli Berlucchi 2011 Casa delle Colonne Zero  (Franciacorta)

Description: This is a mature Champagne with fine almond and buttered toast flavors that are shot with citrus and a bright crisp texture. Well balanced, moving towards the dry spectrum, the wine is well ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Gallimard Père et Fils 2014 Cuvée Prestige Millésime Brut  (Champagne)

Description: A higher proportion of Pinot Noir and longer aging compared to the standard Mosaïque have given this wine richness and the beginnings of mature toastiness. It is balanced, finely textured with crisp apple and spice flavors. Drink the bottling now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Jacquart NV Brut Mosaïque Signature  (Champagne)

Description: As its description suggests this Champagne is dry. But the layers of ripe white-fruit flavors give a balance to the low dosage and bring out a fine texture. Drink this crisp wine with food.                      Roger Voss
Name: Forget-Brimont NV Extra Brut Premier Cru  (Champagne)

Description: Aromas of mature white stone fruit, bread crust, eucalyptus and toasted nut waft out of the glass. Linear and bone dry, the palate offers mature yellow apple, dried orange slice and roasted hazelnut alongside a refined perlage and firm acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fratelli Berlucchi 2011 Casa delle Colonne Zero  (Franciacorta)

Description: This is a mature Champagne with fine almond and buttered toast flavors that are shot with citrus and a bright crisp texture. Well balanced, moving towards the dry spectrum, the wine is well ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Gallimard Père et Fils 2014 Cuvée Prestige Millésime Brut  (Champagne)

Description: A higher proportion of Pinot Noir and longer aging compared to the standard Mosaïque have given this wine richness and the beginnings of mature toastiness. It is balanced, finely textured with crisp apple and spice flavors. Drink the bottling now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Jacquart NV Brut Mosaïque Signature  (Champagne)

Description: A bone-dry Champagne, with a slight preponderance of Pinot Noir in the blend, this succeeds because of the richness of its fruit and the tight texture. The bottling is young, still shockingly fresh and crisp, so wait to drink until 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Devaux NV Ultra D Extra Brut  (Champagne)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A lovely light copper color, this new vintage retains the previous blend of 60% Pinot Noir and 40% Chardonnay. White raspberry, white melon, crisp apple and a hint of jicama combine in this young, fresh wine. There's a suggestion of wet rock underscoring the finish, and the structure certainly suggests giving this another couple of years before drinking as it was just disgorged in the summer of 2020.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Pashey 2017 Brut Rosé Sparkling (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A lovely light copper color, this new vintage retains the previous blend of 60% Pinot Noir and 40% Chardonnay. White raspberry, white melon, crisp apple and a hint of jicama combine in this young, fresh wine. There's a suggestion of wet rock underscoring the finish, and the structure certainly suggests giving this another couple of years before drinking as it was just disgorged in the summer of 2020.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Pashey 2017 Brut Rosé Sparkling (Willamette Valley)

Description: An attractive red-fruit flavored Champagne with a balanced crisp textured, this bottling is just ready to go. Its fruitiness coupled with the soft texture from the dosage are packed with fruitiness and ripe acidity. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Henriot NV Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

Description: With the house signature of a high percentage of Pinot Noir and no or little malolactic fermentation, this famed Champagne remains the hallmark of the producer. It has great freshness as well as bright apple and lemon flavors that have been tempered by four years bottle aging. This bottling is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Lanson NV Le Black Label Brut  (Champagne)

Description: With a dosage veering towards dryness, this Champagne has freshness, red fruits and a liveliness that makes it immediately attractive. The acidity and the light tannic edge will let the bottling age, although, really, it is delicious now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Lanson NV Le Rosé  (Champagne)

Description: Fermented and matured in wood before bottling, this Champagne has an extra layer of complexity and richness. It still keeps the house's dry and mineral character while adding riper spice and lime flavors. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Billecart-Salmon NV Brut Sous Bois  (Champagne)

Description: A lovely touch of red currant plays alongside lemon on the tender nose. The palate strikes a more mellow tone, casting the red currant tartness against a creamy, yeasty core with the merest hint of pleasant phenolic bitterness. A guiding, profound seam of freshness seems to emanate the finest of bubbles on this elegant, pink Sekt.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Bründlmayer NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Österreichischer Sekt)

Description: This is a delicate, perfumed and finely balanced Champagne. It is on the dry side, giving a steely edge that suggests the bottling is young. With the green and citrus fruit and the pure acidity, this fine wine needs to age. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Chanoine NV Tsarine Cuvée Adriana  (Champagne)

Description: From four villages on the Montagne de Reims, this tight and dry Champagne is textured, taut and just beginning to show some maturity. It has a ripe potential, rich, packed with both fruit and minerality. Drink this bottling now.                      Roger Voss
Designation: Enfant de la Montagne Premier Cru Brut
Name: Bertrand-Delespierre NV Enfant de la Montagne Premier Cru Brut  (Champagne)

Description: A blend of the two Pinot grapes, Noir and Meunier, this Champagne is composed of fruit from grand cru vineyards. It is a stylish, structured wine with richness balanced by fine acidity. The dry style has benefited from some bottle aging. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Designation: Charles VII Blanc de Noirs Brut
Name: Canard-Duchêne NV Charles VII Blanc de Noirs Brut  (Champagne)

Description: An extra touch of aging before disgorgement has given this Champagne a fine balance. Hints of toast as well as tight acidity have come from the equal blend of the three main grapes. The fruitiness is still very present, offering crisp citrus to balance the edge of maturity. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Charles Heidsieck NV Brut Réserve  (Champagne)

Description: This salmon-colored sparkler opens with delicate but inviting aromas of white stone fruit, yellow spring flower and freshly baked bread. The palate is downright delicious. Showing flavor and finesse, it delivers juicy pomegranate, yellow apple, lemon drop and white almond alongside tangy acidity and an elegant perlage.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fratelli Berlucchi 2015 Freccianera Rosa  (Franciacorta)

Description: This is a beautifully mature Champagne, rich in secondary flavors, while at the same time keeping great fruits and acidity. The wine is finely balanced, rich with its house style of a good dosage to encourage softness. Drink this wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Gardet NV Prestige Charles Gardet Millésimé  (Champagne)

Description: The main nonvintage cuvée from this young producer who is based just south of Épernay is dry in the house style, giving the tense and finely structured fruit plenty of space to speak. This is a tightly wrought Champagne but one with such great white- and citrus-fruit flavors that it is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: J. M. Sélèque NV Solessence Extra Brut  (Champagne)

Description: A crisp wine that has hints of red fruits as well as a texture that is smoothing out. Balanced and elegant, like all the wines from this producer, this is a fine blend with half Chardonnay and half Pinot Noir. The bottling is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Le Brun de Neuville NV Au Bout du Chemin  (Champagne)

Description: Lovely and refreshing, this has delicate scents of spring wild flower, white stone fruit and a whiff of baked bread. Savory and tangy, the focused palate shows creamy yellow apple, pear and white almond before an orange zest close. Vibrant acidity and tiny, continuous bubbles provide energy and finesse.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Maso Martis NV Brut Sparkling (Trento)

Description: Faint notes of red currant on the nose promise tart berry freshness. A little more air adds promising smokiness. The palate has lovely concentration and an almost austere sense of dryness that nonetheless lends a beautiful sense of serenity. The mousse is fine and lively, and the flavors are understated, dry, classy and very refreshing against a slightly textured backdrop. Very grown up.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Steininger 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon Rosé Sparkling (Österreichischer Sekt)

Description: A flinty sense of reduction is soon followed by creamy, smoky notions of Mirabelle plum on the nose. The palate remains taut and carries the smoky fruit aloft on its myriad creamy bubbles. Tautness and freshness are key on this wonderfully austere and grown-up Sekt. Lemony briskness, autolytic depth and smoldering smokiness make for a great trio. Lovely now but will reward cellaring. Drink 2020–2030.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Schloss Gobelsburg NV Blanc de Blancs Brut Sparkling (Österreichischer Sekt)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A well-rounded, supple texture surrounds attractive toast and nut flavors in this suave and mouthfilling wine. Notes of biscuit, peach and toasted bread give it a nice sense of maturity and complexity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Scharffenberger NV Brut Excellence Sparkling (Anderson Valley)

Description: Fermented and aged in wood, this Champagne is still young but is showing fine potential. The wine's acidity gives it a crisp texture and brings out the citrus and green-apple flavors along with the nervy edge. It will certainly age, so wait to drink until 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Louise Brison 2014 Brut Millésime  (Champagne)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Another fine vintage from Jean-Michel Jussiaume, this is a sincere effort at a Champagne-worthy Oregon sparkler. Made from Chardonnay, it is crisp and fruity, with a spicy hint of anise. The fruit flavors include Meyer lemon, tangerine and ripe pineapple, showing ripeness to counterbalance the bright acidity.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Maison Jussiaume 2017 Brut Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are enchanting, with notes of pear, toasted hazelnuts and Jolly Rancher. The fruit flavors are fresh and lively. There's a creaminess that ups the interest. It brings a sense of seriousness, with vibrant acidity.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Designation: Blanc de Blancs Zero Dosage Méthode Champenoise Extended
Name: Morell-Peña 2017 Blanc de Blancs Zero Dosage Méthode Champenoise Extended Sparkling (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This fresh bubbly is estate grown, done in the méthode Champenoise and 55% Pinot Noir and 45% Chardonnay—a bit different from the 2016 blend. Tart, sleek, clean and zesty, it leans on crisp green apple fruit with a hint of white radish and a refreshing minerality. It was disgorged mid-summer of 2020.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Pashey 2017 Cuvée Extra Brut Sparkling (Willamette Valley)

Description: From the village of Ambonnay on the Montagne de Reims, this crisply textured wine has impressive depth. Its mineral edge comes from the fresh Chardonnay in the blend, giving great white fruits allied to a steely texture. Drink the Champagne now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Soutiran NV Grand Cru Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

Description: Coming from the grand cru village of Bouzy, with its reputation for powerful Pinot Noir, this Champagne has something of that concentration, but balances that with elegance, freshness and plenty of crisp acidity. Its fruitiness, laced with minerality, makes for a wine that is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Designation: Blanc de Noirs Grand Cru Brut
Name: Barnaut NV Blanc de Noirs Grand Cru Brut  (Champagne)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This mouthfilling creamy-textured wine is packed with frothy bubbles that liven up the nicely dry, somewhat tangy flavors of raspberry and cinnamon. A touch of maturity shows up as slightly earthy aromas and lends a bit of complexity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Roederer Estate NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Anderson Valley)

Description: A shy nose gives just a little hint of brioche buns. The palate, beautifully dry, comes with lively, still prickly foam that shows off the purity and lemon freshness of this sparkler, gently rounded by notions of Mirabelle plum. This is pure and straight, light and lemony and will benefit from further bottle age. Drink 2022–2025.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Stift Klosterneuburg NV Mathäi Reserve Sparkling (Österreichischer Sekt)

Description: An impressive blend of 50% Chardonnay, 46% Pinot Noir and 4% Pinot Meunier, this brut is thick and rich in baked apple, brioche and lemon cookie. Lush and creamy on the lengthy palate, it has a fresh, acid-driven finish that brings it in balance.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Domaine Chandon NV Étoile Brut Sparkling (Carneros)

Description: Chardonnay and Pinot Noir mingle minerality with a light structure and crisp acidity. Going towards dryness, the Champagne is tense with a steely edge as well as a perfumed aftertaste. Drink the bottling now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Faniel et Fils NV Oriane Brut  (Champagne)

Description: Bright white fruits and a fine balance between richness and crisp acidity are the hallmarks of the nonvintage Champagne from this producer. Perfumed and with delicious apple and peach fruits, the bottling is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Henriot NV Brut Souverain  (Champagne)

Description: The nonvintage cuvée from this producer is definitely on the dry side. Like many Champagnes in the range, it has benefited from long aging before release, giving a wine that has richness as well as great fruits, hints of maturity coming through. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Laurent-Perrier NV La Cuvée Brut  (Champagne)

Description: Demi-Sec is a fine style both as an apéritif and with fruit desserts. Its sweetness—softness, perhaps—is balanced by a crisp taste of lemon and acidity. This delicious, rich Champagne is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Pol Roger NV Rich Demi-Sec  (Champagne)

Description: White spring flower, orchard fruit and alpine herb mingle with a whiff of pastry dough in this blend of 70% Chardonnay and 30% Pinot Nero. Elegant and racy, the vibrant palate delivers yellow apple, aromatic herb and orange zest alongside crisp acidity and continuous bubbles.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Altemasi 2013 Riserva Graal Metodo Classico Brut Sparkling (Trento)

Description: Based in the village of Bouzy on the Montagne de Reims this producer has access to some fine grand cru vineyards. This Champagne is a ripe blend with richness and an elegant balance of ripe fruit and taut texture. This bottling is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Barnaut NV Grande Réserve Grand Cru Brut  (Champagne)

Description: This grower, based in Verzenay, has created a deliciously crisp, red-fruit and orange-zest flavored rosé Champagne. With a high proportion of Pinot Noir in the blend, the wine is textured with a low dosage and great freshness at the end. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Champagne Sabine Godmé NV Rosé Grand Cru Brut  (Champagne)

Description: Ripe and full of red fruits, this attractive Champagne had five years aging before disgorgement. That has rounded the crisp fruit and filled out the texture. Acidity and fruitiness are equal partners giving a wine that is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Devaux NV D Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

Description: A well-developed vintage Champagne, this has toast as well as crisply sliced apple for a wine that is floral and richly fruity. This is a fine, balanced wine, ripe and almost mature. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Lété-Vautrain 2012 Millésime Brut  (Champagne)

Description: Delicate scents of white stone fruit, yellow spring flower and freshly baked bread waft out of the glass. A blend of 80% Chardonnay and 20% Pinot Nero, the creamy palate features golden apple, Bartlett pear and candied tangerine drop alongside a hint of almond. Crisp acidity and a vibrant perlage provide the framework.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Majolini 2016 Brut  (Franciacorta)

Description: There is a fine touch of maturity and therefore softness to this dry Champagne. Centered on the 2011 vintage, the wine has some fine bottle age as well as a crisp, mineral texture to balance the white fruits. Drink the wine now. Suitable for vegans.                      Roger Voss
Name: Paul Berthelot NV Extra Brut Premier Cru  (Champagne)

Description: A balanced wine, aiming at dryness as well as fruit, this is a ripe blend of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay. It is lightly textured, still with plenty of fresh white fruitiness as well as touches of maturity. Drink this attractively rich Champagne now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Fluteau 2009 Cuvée Symbiose Millésime Brut  (Champagne)

Description: There is some fine bottle age on this cuvée. It has delicious delicate toastiness that still leaves room for the apple and white peach flavors. With its style, the Champagne is perfectly ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Gosset NV Brut Grande Réserve  (Champagne)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The blend is 47% Pinot Noir, 16% Pinot Meunier and 37% Chardonnay, yielding concentrated flavors of rhubarb and wild strawberry. The acidity brings a wash of lemon zest, and the compact density suggests that further bottle age will bring rewarding results. Drink from 2025.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Argyle 2016 Brut Rosé Sparkling (Willamette Valley)

Description: A Champagne that revels in its crisp, textured Chardonnay, this is on the dry side, with fine acidity and tangy citrus as well as green apples. Three years of bottle aging before disgorgment has allowed hints of maturity to just begin to show and to create a fine balance in the wine. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Champagne Sabine Godmé NV Réserve Premier Cru Brut  (Champagne)

Description: With vineyards in the Montagne de Reims, it's no surprise that this blend is dominated by red grapes. It is a rich style, finely mature with red apples, touches of white peach and a zesty edge that is well integrated. Drink the bottling now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Michel Forget NV Brut Premier Cru  (Champagne)

Description: A blend of 75% Chardonnay and 25% Pinot Noir, this has delicate aromas suggesting white spring blossom, summer orchard fruit and a whiff of pastry dough. The creamy palate doles out ripe yellow apple, Bartlett pear, orange zest and white almond alongside a silky mousse. Bright acidity keeps it fresh, clean and balanced.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Revi 2016 Brut Sparkling (Trento)

Description: With its intense red fruits and fine acidity, this Champagne has a real winey character. Its structure, hint of tannins as well as the great fruit are delicious to drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Forget-Brimont NV Grande Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

Description: The aging of this fine Champagne has opened up its natural dryness and added some complexity as well as toasty flavors. It is balanced, crisp and is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Gardet 2013 Extra Brut Millésime  (Champagne)

Description: Even if this was not the greatest vintage in the region, this wine manages to shine through with freshness, displaying white fruit flavors and touches of nuttiness. This is perfectly ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Gervais Gobillard 2013 Millésime Brut  (Champagne)

Description: It's the Pinot Meunier, both in the Champagne blend and in the red addition, that makes this charming wine. It gives the wine its floral character, rich red fruits and subtle poise between freshness and a crisp texture that is comes from the low dosage. The wine has some bottle age and is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: J. M. Sélèque NV Solessence Rosé Extra Brut  (Champagne)

Description: The distinctive bottle with its indented red stripe contains a style of Champagne that is getting better and better. This latest bottling is crisp and full of citrus and apple flavors that are bright and tangy. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: G. H. Mumm NV Grand Cordon Brut  (Champagne)

Description: A majority of 92% Chardonnay is blended with 8% Pinot Blanc in this nicely made wine, given three-and-a-half years of aging on its lees. Austere, elegant and light bodied, it offers flavors of green apple, Meyer lemon and oyster shell.                      Virginie Boone
Designation: By the Bay Reserve Blanc de Blancs P15
Name: Domaine Chandon NV By the Bay Reserve Blanc de Blancs P15 Sparkling (Carneros)

Description: An attractive, now mature, blend of the three Champagne grapes from the Marne Valley, this has a touch of toast along with still bright fresh fruitiness. With a relatively high dosage that has now softened into the maturity of the wine, this is very ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Baron-Fuenté 2011 Millésime Brut  (Champagne)

Description: This cooperative, based in the Marne Valley, highlights Meunier in its blends. This cuvée has fine fruit stemming from the ripe apple flavors, and a fruity and refreshing texture. It is fresh, crisp and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Beaumont des Crayères NV Grande Réserve Brut  (Champagne)

Description: With six years aging before disgorgement, this wine has a fine balance between freshness and maturity. It has a crisp apple flavor and a touch of brioche. With the 20% reserve wine in the blend, this is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Castelnau NV Brut Réserve  (Champagne)

Description: One of the most popular of all Champagnes, this is now showing a freshness that wasn't always there. The crisp texture and green-apple flavors give it an immediate drinkability as well as perfumed acidity and a vibrant aftertaste. Drink this bottling now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Veuve Clicquot Ponsardin NV Yellow Label Brut  (Champagne)

Description: The distinctive bottle with its indented red stripe contains a style of Champagne that is getting better and better. This latest bottling is crisp and full of citrus and apple flavors that are bright and tangy. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: G. H. Mumm NV Grand Cordon Brut  (Champagne)

Description: One of the most popular of all Champagnes, this is now showing a freshness that wasn't always there. The crisp texture and green-apple flavors give it an immediate drinkability as well as perfumed acidity and a vibrant aftertaste. Drink this bottling now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Veuve Clicquot Ponsardin NV Yellow Label Brut  (Champagne)

Description: A majority of 92% Chardonnay is blended with 8% Pinot Blanc in this nicely made wine, given three-and-a-half years of aging on its lees. Austere, elegant and light bodied, it offers flavors of green apple, Meyer lemon and oyster shell.                      Virginie Boone
Designation: By the Bay Reserve Blanc de Blancs P15
Name: Domaine Chandon NV By the Bay Reserve Blanc de Blancs P15 Sparkling (Carneros)

Description: In the generous style that is Ruinart, the wine is full with red fruits that are mouthfilling and rich. At the same time, there is a crisp streak of mineral texture that cuts through the wine to give a bright aftertaste. Drink this beautifully balanced Champagne now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Ruinart NV Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

Description: This is crisply fragrant Champagne, full of tight textures, red-berry fruits and an elegant steeliness from the Chardonnay in the blend. Four years of aging has softened the intense impact of the wine and given it a fine, fresh aftertaste.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vincent d'Astrée NV Brut Premier Cru Rosé  (Champagne)

Description: Aged for a year in wood, this is a rich wine, smoothly textured with spice, toast that is cut with a taut steely edge. The equal proportions of the three main Champagne grapes give balance as well as richness that should soften further. Drink this bottling from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Gardet NV Selected Reserve Extra Brut  (Champagne)

Description: A gentle strawberry note hovers on the nose alongside lemon freshness. The palate is light and shows gentle but persistent foam. It strikes a note of purity and weightlessness and is utterly refreshing with its dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Zantho NV Sparkling (Österreichischer Sekt)

Description: The cuvée from this dynamic cooperative is an affirmation of the Pinot Noir that dominates the Mailly vineyards. It is a ripe, balanced wine with great fruitiness as well as textured acidity. The Champagne is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Mailly Grand Cru NV Brut Réserve  (Champagne)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: This is a blend of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay. Pear and strawberry aromas lead to a palate full of apple flavors and crisp acidity that ups the interest.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Designation: Field Blend Organic Pétillant Naturel Acadia Vineyard
Name: Pét Project 2019 Field Blend Organic Pétillant Naturel Acadia Vineyard Sparkling (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Description: In the generous style that is Ruinart, the wine is full with red fruits that are mouthfilling and rich.
