At the same time, there is a crisp streak of mineral texture that cuts through the wine to give a bright aftertaste. Drink this beautifully balanced Champagne now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Ruinart NV Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

Description: This is a mineral-textured rosé, made almost entirely from Chardonnay with added Pinot Noir wine for the color. It's all about freshness, crisp apples and a tight texture that makes a refreshing aftertaste. Drink the bottling now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Colin NV Cuvée Rosé Premier Cru Brut  (Champagne)

Description: The five years of aging in bottle and the 40% reserve wine have given this rich blend of Pinot Noir and Champagne great balance as well as intensity and ripeness. The wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Devaux NV Cuvée D Brut  (Champagne)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The blend in 2016 is quite different from the previous vintage, reversing the roles of the Pinot Noir (35%) and Chardonnay (55%), with a splash of Pinot Meunier as before. It's young and fresh, with crisp apple fruit flavors in a compact, well-defined frame. There is clearly some aging potential, though where the flavors will go from here is anyone's guess.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Argyle 2016 Vintage Brut Sparkling (Willamette Valley)

Description: This bone-dry Champagne is, as so often, too young. Its intense crispness and tight texture promise much as the wine ages and opens out. Look for white fruits, an always steely edge and a fine balance. Drink this bottling from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Boizel NV Ultime Zéro Dosage Brut Nature  (Champagne)

Description: A distinctive gold bottle sets this Meunier-dominated Champagne in a ripe, rich maturity. The wine has fine toastiness, a floral character that has evolved into nuttiness and a soft, generous aftertaste. Drink the wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Charles de Cazanove 2009 Cuvée Stradivarius Brut  (Champagne)

Description: With a high proportion of the two Pinots in the blend, this cuvée is a ripe and floral Champagne. This bottling has some age which has produced a touch of toast to add to the crisp, dry texture. It's an attractive, fruity and mature Champagne, ready to drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Perrier Jouët NV Grand Brut  (Champagne)

Description: Produced from Grand and Premier Cru fruit, this Champagne is textured with a fine line of acidity to balance the peach and apple flavors. With its crispness and bubbly fruitiness the wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vranken NV Diamant Brut  (Champagne)

Description: With a high proportion of Chardonnay, this is a crisp cuvée. An edge of minerality adds complexity to the Champagne's texture and enhances its white fruits. This fine bottling is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Alfred Gratien NV Brut  (Champagne)

Description: In a sign of a world of riper Champagne grapes, this familiar brand now has a zero-dosage version. It is certainly crisp and dry, but the richness of the fruit gives it a fine balance. This bottling could be kept for a few months for the tight texture to open out. So drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Joseph Perrier NV Cuvée Royale Brut Nature  (Champagne)

Description: Off dry and with a soft touch of creamed apple fruits, this is a beautifully balanced wine. Floral and open with white-fruit flavors, a hint of honey and just a touch of textured minerality, this Champagne is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Lanson NV Le White Label Sec  (Champagne)

Description: With a high proportion of the two Pinots in the blend, this cuvée is a ripe and floral Champagne. This bottling has some age which has produced a touch of toast to add to the crisp, dry texture. It's an attractive, fruity and mature Champagne, ready to drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Perrier Jouët NV Grand Brut  (Champagne)

Description: With a high proportion of Chardonnay, this is a crisp cuvée. An edge of minerality adds complexity to the Champagne's texture and enhances its white fruits. This fine bottling is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Alfred Gratien NV Brut  (Champagne)

Description: Attractively poised between softness and crispness, this best-selling Champagne is packed with ripe white fruits that are given a lift by the tight acidity. Its reliability and the increasing dryness and freshness of the wine are exemplary. This bottling is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Moët & Chandon NV Brut Impérial  (Champagne)

Description: A blend of 80% Chardonnay and 20% Pinot Nero, this elegant sparkler offers delicate aromas of hawthorn, citrus and white stone fruit. Made without dosage, the dry palate offers yellow apple, orange rind and a hint of white almond alongside vibrant acidity. A racy refined perlage provides the backdrop.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Monogram 2016 Zero  (Franciacorta)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine spent three months in concrete egg prior to secondary fermentation. With all of the fruit from Solaksen Vineyard, pleasing aromas of baked bread and strawberry are followed by creamy-feeling flavors. It's a modern-style sparkler that brings a sense of seriousness.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Morell-Peña 2017 Blanc de Noirs Extended Sparkling (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: As its name suggests this is a bone-dry style: a blend of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay. It has had the advantage of bottle aging which gives an attractive edge of toast to the tight crispness of the wine. It's a fine Champagne for food, and is ready to drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Soutiran NV Grand Cru Brut Nature  (Champagne)

Description: The mountain in the name of this wine is the Montagne de Reims. The Champagne with its attractive pale color and fresh acidity is balanced with plenty of freshness as well as a light texture from the Pinot Noir in the blend. This is a fine wine, crisp and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Designation: Enfant de la Montagne Premier Cru Rosé Brut
Name: Bertrand-Delespierre NV Enfant de la Montagne Premier Cru Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

Description: The cuvée from this great Champagne producer is dry, fruity with a fine line of minerality. That is balanced by the apple and crisp citrus-fruit flavors coming together in a vibrant, textured wine. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Billecart-Salmon NV Brut Réserve  (Champagne)

Description: This is Boizel's cuvée, an attractively balanced wine with ripe apples and perfumed acidity. Like all Champagnes from this producer, it has a majority of Pinot Noir in the blend bringing richness and a fine texture. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Boizel NV Brut Réserve  (Champagne)

Description: Dominated by Meunier from the Marne Valley, this smooth, floral and fruity Champagne is delicious. It is fresh while rich, with creamy apple flavors and touches of apricot. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Charles Mignon NV Premium Réserve Brut  (Champagne)

Description: With its 80% of red grapes, this cuvée has structure and fine richness. It has some bottle age while retaining freshness and offers a balanced Champagne that is seamlessly fruity and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Piper-Heidsieck NV Cuvée Brut  (Champagne)

Description: A blend of the 2013 and 2014 vintages plus reserve wine, this Champagne has concentration as well as intense white fruit. Its freshness comes from the mineral and structured blend of Chardonnay and Pinot Noir. Drink this bottling now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Soutiran NV Grand Cru Signature Brut  (Champagne)

Description: This producer in Hautvillers close to Épernay has made a rosé that while it has plenty of signs of attractive maturity also has buoyant fruitiness. The Champagne is tangy and edgy to contrast with open fruits. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Gervais Gobillard 2014 Millésime Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

Description: Dominated by Meunier from the Marne Valley, this smooth, floral and fruity Champagne is delicious. It is fresh while rich, with creamy apple flavors and touches of apricot. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Charles Mignon NV Premium Réserve Brut  (Champagne)

Description: A flowered bottle showcases a fine, dry Champagne. Fruit and bright acidity are the focus of this lightly textured and mineral wine. The bottling is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Ernest Rapeneau NV Extra Brut Limited Edition  (Champagne)

Description: A softly textured and ripe fruity wine, this has an attractive balance and a floral character. The wine's dosage gives a rich feel to the Champagne that is fruity and gentle at the end.                      Roger Voss
Name: H. Blin NV Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

Description: A softly textured and ripe fruity wine, this has an attractive balance and a floral character. The wine's dosage gives a rich feel to the Champagne that is fruity and gentle at the end.                      Roger Voss
Name: H. Blin NV Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

Description: The 70% Pinot Meunier in the blend gives this wine its great fruitiness. It is a balanced wine, with five years on the lees and a backdrop of richness and fine white fruits. Drink this bottling now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Lancelot-Pienne NV Accord Majeur Assemblage Brut  (Champagne)

Description: The cuvée from this family-owned producer brings together the two red grapes, Pinot Noir and Meunier. That makes for a floral Champagne that emphasizes ripe, textured white fruits, with just a touch of crisp tangy citrus. This young bottling is vibrant and will be better from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Faniel et Fils NV Agapane Brut  (Champagne)

Description: A deep-colored rosé, this is based on grand cru Pinot Noir. That gives the Champagne richness and density with flavors of red-currant freshness as well as a touch of structure. Drink this ripe wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Barnaut NV Authentique Rosé  (Champagne)

Description: This bone-dry Champagne is a blend across vineyards in five villages. The result is crisp, lightly textured with plenty of ripe green-apple flavors and perfumed acidity. There is a steely edge to the wine that gives it shape. Drink the bottling now. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Canard-Duchêne NV P181 Extra Brut  (Champagne)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Apple, pear and apple skin aromas are followed by bright, crisp flavors. It delivers a lot of quality and value.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Domaine Ste. Michelle NV Brut Méthode Champenoise Sparkling (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This grower south of Épernay has brought together the three Champagne grapes in equal proportions for this cuvée. It is just as balanced in its flavors, poised with fresh acidity and a dosage that gives crispness and also brings out white fruits. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Etienne Oudart NV Brut Réference  (Champagne)

Description: A deliciously balanced Champagne, this is crisp and fruity. Red-berry flavors are given a tang of citrus and a light mineral texture to produce a young wine that is, however, very drinkable now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Forget-Brimont NV Brut Rosé Premier Cru  (Champagne)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Apple, pear and apple skin aromas are followed by bright, crisp flavors. It delivers a lot of quality and value.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Domaine Ste. Michelle NV Brut Méthode Champenoise Sparkling (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This crisp and fruity Champagne is deliciously fresh with acidity, red-currant and orange-zest flavors and a tight edge of minerality. With its fine balance and three years aging before disgorgement it is finely poised and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Pommery NV Brut Rosé Royal  (Champagne)

Description: This is a side project from winemaker Linn Scott (Sparkman Cellars). With two years en tirage, the aromas are compelling, with notes of baked bread, pear and apple. Vanilla and lemony flavors follow. Some oak seems to step in the way of an otherwise lovely wine.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Six Atmospheres 2016 Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Washington)

Description: The Champagne from the Épernay cooperative is very much in line with the crisp, tight and elegant quality of the whole range. The Meunier gives a fruity character along with attractive perfumes while the Chardonnay brings in the more textured style. Drink the wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vincent d'Astrée NV Brut Premier Cru  (Champagne)

Description: Half-and-half Pinot Noir and Pinot Meunier from the Marne Valley, this Champagne floats softly and with ripe fruitiness. There is freshness from the bright floral character and the touch of minerality. The wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Charles Orban NV Blanc de Noirs Brut  (Champagne)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Smooth and modestly fruity, this medium-bodied bubbly offers light cherry and raspberry flavors that ride a fine bead of effervescence. It's very pleasant to sip and has a soft finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Scharffenberger NV Brut Rosé Excellence Sparkling (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Very appealing aromas of baked bread, poached pear and citrus are followed by crisp apple flavors. It's thoroughly enchanting and a bargain to boot.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Domaine Ste. Michelle NV Brut Rosé Méthode Champenoise Sparkling (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Darker in color than some rosés, this is also rich in texture. Its crisp red-currant fruits are filled out with richness and lifted with a lively, dry acidity. Drink the Champagne now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Faniel et Fils NV Perlane Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

Description: Equal proportions of the three main Champagne grapes give a brightly fruity wine with some structure from the two Pinots and a more mineral character from the Chardonnay. Hints of red fruits complete an attractive, Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Gervais Gobillard NV Brut Authentique Rosé  (Champagne)

Description: An attractive, strawberry-flavored Champagne, this is soft with just a light texture and plenty of ripe fruitiness. The wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Jacquart NV Mosaïque Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pear aromas are out front, followed by notes of spice and citrus. Plentiful, lightly sweet strawberry flavors follow. It's an enjoyable, well-priced, sweeter-style sparkler.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Domaine Ste. Michelle NV Extra Dry Méthode Champenoise Sparkling (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This is a soft, rounded Champagne that has red-berry flavors bursting through acidity and a crisp texture. This is an immediately attractive wine, tangy and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Alfred Gratien NV Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

Description: A bright, balanced Champagne that is full of apple fruits refreshingly tangy. With its crisp texture balanced by a soft heart, the wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Chanoine NV Cuvée Brut  (Champagne)

Description: Dominated by Meunier, this textured, balanced and fruity wine is totally ready to drink. With a bright edge of acidity and a tendency towards dryness, the Champagne is attractively crisp and fruity.                      Roger Voss
Name: Roland Champion NV Cuvée d'Aramis  (Champagne)

Description: A beautifully balanced Champagne based on the 2016 harvest, this is fresh, full of crisp apples and layered with a strongly mineral texture. This bottling is still a little young and will be better from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Soutiran NV Cuvée Alexandre Premier Cru Brut  (Champagne)

Description: This softly textured wine has attractive red-fruit flavors like strawberry. A relatively high dosage gives a smooth aftertaste. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Designation: Cuvée du Fondateur Rosé Millésimé Brut
Name: Trouillard 2015 Cuvée du Fondateur Rosé Millésimé Brut  (Champagne)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pear aromas are out front, followed by notes of spice and citrus. Plentiful, lightly sweet strawberry flavors follow. It's an enjoyable, well-priced, sweeter-style sparkler.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Domaine Ste. Michelle NV Extra Dry Méthode Champenoise Sparkling (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This Aube-based producer has crafted a rich style of rosé Champagne, laden with red fruits from the Pinot Noir red wine. There is texture as well as a crisper minerality from the Chardonnay in the blend. The wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Fluteau NV Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

Description: The cuvée from this producer is ripe, rounded, showing dryness as well as plenty of fruit. The Champagne's texture gives it a fine zest of acidity and minerality to balance the citrus and peach fruit flavors. Drink this bottling now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Forget-Brimont NV Brut Premier Cru  (Champagne)

Description: A soft red-fruit and citrus flavored rosé, this Champagne has a warm rich feel. The dominance of Pinot Meunier gives a floral, fruity character that makes it instantly attractive. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Lété-Vautrain NV Rosé Royal Brut  (Champagne)

Description: A rosé de saignée, with the color coming from grape skins rather than the usual Champagne idea of adding red wine, this wine has a really pink color. It also has a tannic edge that gives some structure to the red fruits and ripe acidity. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Designation: Rosé de Saignée Experience Extra Brut
Name: André Jacquart NV Rosé de Saignée Experience Extra Brut  (Champagne)

Description: This is a rich Champagne, full of red fruits underlining its crisp texture. Smooth and full of generous fruitiness, it has a fine balance and is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Charles Mignon NV Premium Réserve Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

Description: Fruity while also textured, this is an attractive, red-fruit-flavored Champagne. Its acidity and texture are just right to give freshness to the wine's fruitiness. Drink the bottling now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Michel Forget NV Rosé Premier Cru Brut  (Champagne)

Description: This is a smoothly textured Champagne, with just the right amount of crispness and raspberry fruits to balance the light tangy texture. The wine is fruity and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Moët & Chandon NV Rosé Impérial Brut  (Champagne)

Description: The Champagne has tight minerality as well as fresh citrus and green-plum fruitiness. Zingy, crisp and with a steely edge, this is a finely wrought Champagne. This bottling will be ready from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Albert Lebrun NV Premier Cru Brut  (Champagne)

Description: A crisply balanced rosé, this is salmon-pink in color and fruity in flavor. Delicate red-berry flavors are encased in a soft texture and lit by acidity. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Etienne Oudart NV Brut Rosé Réference  (Champagne)

Description: With 50% Pinot Meunier in the blend, this Champagne has a fine floral character and hints of yellow fruits on the palate. It is a rich wine, balancing ripe fruit with acidity. Drink the bottling now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Infinite Eight NV Brut Infinite  (Champagne)

Description: This is a ripe, fruity and finely balanced Champagne with a freshness coming from Chardonnay. It is rich but also with a fine, textured line of white fruits. It is totally ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Jacquart NV Brut Mosaïque  (Champagne)

Description: This is a ripe, fruity and finely balanced Champagne with a freshness coming from Chardonnay. It is rich but also with a fine, textured line of white fruits. It is totally ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Jacquart NV Brut Mosaïque  (Champagne)

Description: Produced in the Aube region this is an attractively balanced blend dominated by Meunier. It has an attractive contrast between the Champagne's floral character and the fresh aftertaste. Drink the bottling now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Jean de Villaré NV Grande Réserve Brut  (Champagne)

Description: Fruity while also textured, this is an attractive, red-fruit-flavored Champagne. Its acidity and texture are just right to give freshness to the wine's fruitiness. Drink the bottling now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Michel Forget NV Rosé Premier Cru Brut  (Champagne)

Description: This is a smoothly textured Champagne, with just the right amount of crispness and raspberry fruits to balance the light tangy texture. The wine is fruity and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Moët & Chandon NV Rosé Impérial Brut  (Champagne)

Description: The Champagne has tight minerality as well as fresh citrus and green-plum fruitiness. Zingy, crisp and with a steely edge, this is a finely wrought Champagne. This bottling will be ready from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Albert Lebrun NV Premier Cru Brut  (Champagne)

Description: Aromas of mature white stone fruit, medicinal herb and a whiff of bread crust form the nose. The aromas carry over to the vibrant palate along with peach, citrus drop and a hint of bitter nut set against a vivacious perlage.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Rotari 2015 Platinum Label Brut Sparkling (Trento)

Description: With its softness and relatively high dosage, this is an easy style of rosé. Its ripe strawberry flavors are lightly touched by acidity and a crisp texture that keeps everything in order. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Perrier Jouët NV Blason Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

Description: Certainly dry and crisp, this is a green-apple and mineral textured Champagne. There is a contrasting floral edge to the wine giving it a perfumed character. Drink this fruity wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Baron-Fuenté NV Esprit Brut Nature  (Champagne)

Description: Both red grapes are prominent in this fruity Champagne. With a balanced dosage and floral fruits, the wine is crisp while having a soft edge. Drink the wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Beaumont des Crayères NV Grand Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

Description: From estate-grown Pinot Noir grapes made in a Méthode Champenoise style, this sparkler is nutty in black cherry, grenadine and blood orange, richly textured in style with moderate structure.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Belden Barns 2017 Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Sonoma Mountain)

Description: This fruity Champagne is full of raspberry flavors. The wine's crispness gives a fine lift of acidity and adds a tangy texture at the end. Drink this attractive bottling now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Castelnau NV Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

Description: Apricot, mineral water, saline and petrol aromas make up the nose, which precedes a plump palate. Flavors of apple sauce, powdered sugar and almond croissant carry on the medium-long finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Castillo Rocio NV Gran Brut Rosé Sparkling (Cava)

Description: A ripe Champagne from the Aube region, this is a classic blend of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay. With its ripe white fruits and soft texture, the wine is about fruitiness. Touches of nuttiness come from the reserve wines in the blend. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Fluteau NV Cuvée Réservée Brut  (Champagne)

Description: A well-balanced and ripe wine, this is a fully-formed Champagne. The texture has softened into white fruits and hints of kiwi as well as touches of nuttiness. This cuvée is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Gardet NV Brut Tradition  (Champagne)

Description: With its dominance of Pinot Meunier, this is a softly textured Champagne, but with a fine bite of citrus along with almond flavors. Perfumed and fruity, it is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Gérin NV Comtesse Gérin Grande Réserve Brut  (Champagne)

Description: Entirely made from Chardonnay, this dark-yellow sparkler has a bounce to its mousse, a rich, creamy offering of apple, pear and vanilla cookie.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Gloria Ferrer NV Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Carneros)

Description: Rich and lush, this is an approachable, widely appealing sparkler, combining 88% Pinot Noir with 12% Chardonnay. Apple, dark-cherry and vanilla-cookie flavors combine with ease.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Gloria Ferrer NV Sonoma Brut Sparkling (Carneros)

Description: Rich and lush, this is an approachable, widely appealing sparkler, combining 88% Pinot Noir with 12% Chardonnay. Apple, dark-cherry and vanilla-cookie flavors combine with ease.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Gloria Ferrer NV Sonoma Brut Sparkling (Carneros)

Description: The rich, rounded Champagne has fine fruitiness and an edge of tangy minerality. It has structure, an apple-peel flavor along with plenty of final acidity. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Jacques Lorent NV Premier Cru Brut  (Champagne)

Description: A classic of its kind, this is soft with a relatively high dosage while also having a fine balance between ripeness and a crisper fresh character. The bottling is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Veuve Clicquot Ponsardin NV Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

Description: This producer, based to the south of Épernay, has created a cuvée that offers fruitiness while also a light structure. Crisp apple and citrus flavors are balanced by the taut texture of a Champagne that is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vollereaux NV Réserve Brut  (Champagne)

Description: Apricot, mineral water, saline and petrol aromas make up the nose, which precedes a plump palate. Flavors of apple sauce, powdered sugar and almond croissant carry on the medium-long finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Castillo Rocio NV Gran Brut Rosé Sparkling (Cava)

Description: This is an attractive fruity rosé. Its soft texture from a relatively high dosage balances well with the strawberry fruitiness and light acidity. Drink this Champagne now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Gardet NV Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

Description: Very much in the house style that emphasizes the two Pinots, the cuvée from this producer is ripe, softly textured but with a rich structure and fine fruitiness from the apple and spice flavors. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Canard-Duchêne NV Brut  (Champagne)

Description: The Champagne from this producer has the house style of soft, integrated fruitiness with attractive acidity. Apples and fresh citrus come together with the soft texture to produce a wine that is very ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Chanoine NV Tsarine Cuvée Premium Brut  (Champagne)

Description: This is an attractive fruity rosé. Its soft texture from a relatively high dosage balances well with the strawberry fruitiness and light acidity. Drink this Champagne now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Gardet NV Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The winery identifies this as 2018 vintage and made by the traditional Champagne method, though no vintage date appears anywhere on the label and no dosage was added. It leans a bit toward sweetness, with crisp flavors of apple sauce and bread dough.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Sweet Cheeks NV Trio Vintner's Reserve Sparkling (Willamette Valley)

Description: Almost entirely Chardonnay with the addition of Pinot Noir as red wine, this Champagne is crisp and brightly fruity. Acidity and minerality are present to go with the white fruits and relatively high dosage. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vranken NV Demoiselle Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

Description: A crisp and balanced Champagne, this is full of red-fruit and citrus flavors. It is just right, a bright, fruity wine that is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Ernest Rapeneau NV Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

Description: This Champagne comes from the Aube region, hence its warmth and rich texture. It has an easy balance of fruit and texture, and comes across as both perfumed and rounded. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Monthuys Père et Fils NV Brut Réserve  (Champagne)

Description: This is a soft Champagne that aims for fruitiness. With red-apple flavors that are cut with lime, the wine is open and very ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Charles Orban NV Carte Noire Brut  (Champagne)

Description: This is a perfectly dry Champagne, but its dryness is softened by the ripe fruit. It should really be aged further in bottle in order to open up the fruit and smooth out the tight texture. Wait to drink it until 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Lété-Vautrain NV Zéro Brut  (Champagne)

Description: This is a soft wine with a relatively high dosage. That combination produces creamed apple fruits and light acidity with an open, fruity character. The Champagne is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Louis Chalvon NV Brut Grande Réserve  (Champagne)

Description: This soft Champagne is easy to drink, and is rounded out with some creamy apple flavors. The crisp Chardonnay has been softened by the wine's dosage and that leaves the wine with light acidity and a good balance. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vranken NV Demoiselle Brut  (Champagne)

Description: A Pinot Noir-dominated Champagne, this has white fruits and an open texture, giving a soft and fruity character. This nonvintage cuvée from the producer is attractive to drink, soft at the end.                      Roger Voss
Name: Heidsieck & Co Monopole NV Blue Top Brut  (Champagne)

Description: A light orange color and yeasty aromas open this vintage rosé Cava. The palate is foamy but brings tight acidity, while this tastes vaguely of tangerine and kumquat.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Pere Ventura 2014 Vintage Rosé Gran Reserva Brut Sparkling (Cava)

Description: This producer in the Aube has made a soft style of Champagne that emphasizes fruitiness and a soft texture. The wine is full of red-berry flavors, with ripe acidity and is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Rémy Massin et Fils NV Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

Description: The wine, while it has a high dosage, is balanced with ripe white fruits showing well against a backdrop of ripe acidity. The Champagne is softly textured and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Baron-Fuenté NV Grande Réserve Brut  (Champagne)

Description: The style of this brand, with its high proportion of Meunier, gives a soft Champagne that is very accessible and immediately delicious. Its fruitiness and floral character are totally ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Comte Stanislas NV Cuvée Sélection Brut  (Champagne)

Description: This off-dry Champagne is a fine accompaniment to pâtés and mushroom dishes as well as fruit desserts. Its soft texture is balanced by some refreshing acidity, with creamed apples and citrus coming together. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: H. Blin NV Demi-Sec  (Champagne)

Description: Produced from grapes grown in the Marne Valley, this Meunier-dominated Champagne is ripe, fruity and with an attractive balance of fresh apple and citrus flavors. It is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Jacques Lorent NV Grande Réserve Brut  (Champagne)

Description: This is a deep-colored rosé giving both richness and a light tannic edge. Made by getting the color from the grape skins rather than the usual Champagne practice of adding red wine, this wine is more wine than Champagne. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Baron-Fuenté NV Esprit Rosé de Saignée Brut  (Champagne)

Description: The ripe tannins of Pinot Noir come through strongly in this softly textured wine. With raspberry flavors that are balanced by generous acidity, this is a rosé Champagne that is easy to drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Boizel NV Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

Description: An open, textured and fruity wine, this is crisp while also having plenty of soft red-fruit flavors. The dosage gives the wine its ripe character, making it a Champagne that is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Léon Launois NV Rosé Cuvée Réservée Brut  (Champagne)

Description: A softly ripe Champagne with red fruits that are easily balanced against the soft texture and raspberry aftertaste. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Comte Stanislas NV Cuvée Sélection Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

Description: Lemon and strawberry candy are vivid on the nose. The frothy, fresh palate intensifies the strawberry candy notes with its lively bubbles. The finish is off-dry and appetizing.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: R&A Pfaffl NV Secco Rosé Sparkling (Österreichischer Perlwein)

Description: As a Champagne with a high dosage, this is soft and fruity with raspberry flavors. With its ripeness and red-fruit flavors, the wine is gently textured and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Montaudon NV Grande Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

Description: As a Champagne with a high dosage, this is soft and fruity with raspberry flavors. With its ripeness and red-fruit flavors, the wine is gently textured and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Montaudon NV Grande Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

Description: A soft Champagne that emphasizes fruit rather than texture, this is ripe with strawberry flavors. A dominance of the two red Pinots in the blend gives the wine additional richness and generosity at the end. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Canard-Duchêne NV Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

Description: This is a soft Champagne, ripe with red fruits and an easy texture that invites immediate drinking. The wine is fruity, tangy with candied strawberry and light acidity. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Chanoine NV Tsarine Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

Description: This is a relatively high-dosage Champagne, very much in the style of the producer that has varied little over the years. It is balanced and fruity, full of red fruits. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Heidsieck & Co Monopole NV Rosé Top Brut  (Champagne)

Description: This Champagne is full of fruits, apples, crisp kiwi and white peach, At the same time, it has a fine texture, is accessible and tangy, and still keeps the house style of a high dosage and a soft aftertaste. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Montaudon NV Brut  (Champagne)

Description: Apple, pear and sourdough aromas set up a sound palate that's a bit cheeky and fizzy. Dry, grassy pear and green melon flavors fade slowly. Overall, this shows flashes of quality but ultimately it's a basic sparkler for everyday enjoyment.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Casas Del Mar NV Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Cava)

Description: Made in a soft red-fruit flavored style, this is an attractive and fruity Champagne. There is a bit of acidity at the end. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Chanoine NV Cuvée Rosé  (Champagne)

Description: This is a soft high-dosage wine, with strawberry fruits and acidity. It is a fruity Champagne dominated by the red grapes and is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Jacques Lorent NV Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

Description: From a good vintage, this Champagne is now totally mature, perhaps a little old. Its nuttiness is being transformed into vegetal flavors that demand the wine is drunk immediately.                      Roger Voss
Name: Charles de Cazanove 2007 Vieille France Brut Vintage  (Champagne)

Description: A rusty orange color and heavy aromas of apricot and citrus fruits set up a palate, with just barely enough acidity to keep this pumping. Cantaloupe and citrus flavors are bland and creamy through the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Jaume Serra 2016 Rosé Brut Sparkling (Cava)

Description: Briny apple and citrus aromas come with a note of mustard. On the palate, this brut is standard. Apple and briny stone-fruit flavors are short and show some latent bitterness on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Parés Baltà NV Brut Sparkling (Cava)

Description: A ripe fruity style of rosé, this is softly textured with a high dosage. Strawberry flavors and light acidity leave a Champagne that is open and easy to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Charles de Cazanove NV Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

Description: This medium-bodied wine offers a frothy effervescence, straightforward fruit and cider flavors and a touch of sweetness.                      Jim Gordon
Name: San Rucci NV Extra Dry Sparkling (California)

Description: Stalky white-fruit aromas come across as sweet, while this basic brut is superficial on the palate. Grassy pear and melon flavors are a bit sweet and candied, while this is plump and slightly bitter on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Tarantas NV Brut Made With Organic Grapes Sparkling (Cava)

Description: Grassy aromas come with notes of tarragon but also sulfur. A flat palate with minimal bubble action is braced by white-grape acidity, while salty flavors of orange and tangerine are zesty but sketchy.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Mi Terruño NV Expresión Extra Brut Sparkling (Mendoza)

Description: Harsh aromas of mustard, burnt corn and yeast require compromise, while lemony acidity with almost no bubbles forms the mouthfeel. Green apple flavors are sour and offset by a touch of yeast, while this pushes citric acidity on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Alma 4 2014 Chardonnay Sparkling (Uco Valley)

Description: Aromas of jellied orange candy are unconvincing but inoffensive. This rosé sparkler feels foamy and unfocused, while flavors of dry melon turn bitter in front of a clunky finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Tapiz NV Malbec Rosé Extra Brut Sparkling (Mendoza)

Description: This is a Champagne that has some maturity while also having crisp fruit. There is a distinct disconnect between the elements here.                      Roger Voss
Name: Baron-Fuenté NV Rose Dolorès Brut  (Champagne)

Description: Harsh aromas of tire rubber and petrol are low on fruit. On the palate, this is foamy to an extreme, with little elegance or finesse. Incongruent flavors of cantaloupe and carrot are slightly bitter on a foamy finish.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Brut Rosé Made with Organic Grapes
Name: Tarantas NV Brut Rosé Made with Organic Grapes Sparkling (Cava)

Description: Green herb and lettuce aromas are out front on a low-fruit nose, while this Cava is flat as a board with almost no bubbles. Briny citrus flavors are limited, while this reverts to flat on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Marquis de Sade NV Metodo Tradicional Premium Brut Sparkling (Cava)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: On the palate, this is flat and dull. Bitter white-fruit flavors carry over to a murky finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Inkarri NV Brut Made with Organic Grapes Sparkling (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Wheat bran, lemon and citrus pith are pure and insistent on the wine's nose with a sideline of almost ethereal lemon zest. The palate is lithe and pure—slender, concentrated, fizzing with intent. The bright, pristine core of lithe but intense lemon freshness lies bare, obscured only occasionally with the fizz and burst of a pristine bubble, but essentially naked in its chalky purity. Just a touch austere, but all the more revealing for it.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Designation: Thr Trouble with Dreams #ZODO Zero Dosage
Name: Sugrue 2014 Thr Trouble with Dreams #ZODO Zero Dosage Sparkling (England)

Description: Notes of lemony shortbread on the wine's nose have an additional dimension of earthy, chalky wheat bran. The palate is concentrated, trained like an arrow to go straight for the pleasure center of the brain, exploding with precise, vivid, creamy and smooth freshness on its tight and taut body. The quality of the foam is exquisite, the freshness is pristine, and the experience almost cleansing, but enriching, too. The dry finish compels you to sip more.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Hoffmann & Rathbone 2014 Classic Cuvée Brut Sparkling (England)

Description: A touch of wheat bran on the nose has an inflection of golden, candied lemon peel. The palate comes in with notions of cold, salted butter, creamy roundness and slender, concentrated lemon pith. Vivid briskness at its core informs and illuminates everything. Gentle foam lends extra life, and subtle depth draws you in. This is pure, dry, brisk and bold.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Sugrue 2014 The Trouble with Dreams Sparkling (England)

Description: The creamy, ripe freshness of Red Delicious apple flesh is gentle and pure on the wine's nose. That lovely bright, creamy mellowness carries seamlessly onto the palate, where the creamy foam smooths and bubbles over everything in still youthful exuberance. There is roundness in that body, curve and sinuousness, but the finish is pristine, linear, taut and dry. Lovely.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Gusbourne Estate 2016 Rosé Brut Sparkling (England)

Description: Beeswax, shortbread and lemon vie for predominance on the fragrant nose of this wine. The palate expands the beeswax notions and adds dried citrus peel and pith, giving a concentrated core with beguiling autolytic depth. A seaweed umami richness and saltiness comes across like a fusion of miso and buttery shortbread. The foam is fine, with tiny bubbles that glide with creaminess. It's sheer delight for lovers of mature fizz.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jean-Claude Buecher 2009 Insomnia Extra Brut Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

Description: Notions of rye bread and fresh brioche rise from the glass, spreading mellowness. The palate of this wine comes in with that same richness of evolution that is deep, salty, yeasty and complex, evoking chalky depth and freshness. The finish is rounded, wonderfully dry and long.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: René Muré 2014 Grand Millésime Extra Brut Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

Description: Creamy richness and lemon-rind zestiness on this wine's subtle nose evoke lemony shortcrust pastry. Yeasty depth also characterizes the citrusy palate, which offers fine saltiness, vivid lemon and gentle, but enduring effervescence. This wine is bone dry, harmonious and elegant.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jean-Claude Buecher 2015 Reflets Brut Nature Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

Description: Chamomile headiness reaches the nose first, followed by lemon purity and a hint of shortbread. The palate of this wine comes in with subtle suggestions of dried citrus rind and white currant, all with a pithy concentration. Very fine foam swishes with creaminess and elegance, accenting that citrus-laden freshness with each tiny burst. Gorgeous and complex, the wine has a long, bone-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Bott-Geyl NV Absolut Extra Brut Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

Description: The nose shines with the subtle richness of buttery, raw shortcrust pastry but also has a lovely inflection of smoke and lemon. This autolytic richness carries right over onto the slender, smooth palate where an edge of honey is just hinted at. The foam is fine and creamy, and the balance is striking. A most elegant debut for this first release with a sonorous, dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Roebuck Estates 2014 Classic Cuvée Brut Sparkling (England)

Description: Buttery shortbread notes immediately conquer the nose with their richness. This is followed by a flicker of nutty, smoky oak seemingly bedded in saltiness. The palate simply confirms these notions on a slender but creamy palate where very fine, tiny bubbles heighten both creaminess and freshness. This is mellow but piercingly fresh, elegant and utterly vivacious. The finish is dry, long and resonant.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Hattingley Valley Wines 2014 Kings Cuvée Sparkling (England)

Description: The first whiff of Red Delicious apple on the nose immediately signals mellow creaminess. This notion is even more enforced on the smooth, rich, almost buttery palate, where the fine, mellow apple fruit holds bright, vivid freshness. The richness sits incredibly well with the slenderness of the body. It has an elegant, long and dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Henners 2014 Brut Reserve Sparkling (England)

Description: Subtle hints of shortcrust pastry and red apple on the wine's nose promise mellowness from the get-go. The slender but smooth palate delivers right away with its gentle, fine foam caressing the palate, conveying apple freshness and ripeness and that smooth, profound fruitiness. The yeasty backdrop has a fine trace of smoke, adding allure and intrigue. A lovely, smooth wine, grown-up somehow, and very classy in its understatement.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Harrow & Hope Ltd. 2015 Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (England)

Description: Notions of spiky lemon zest and rounded shortbread vie for dominance on the wine's lively nose. These opposing elements manage to unite on the palate, which fizzes with slenderness and generosity, salty chalk, vivid lemon and mellow, almost creamy apple. Much is going on, drawing you in, arresting and enlivening our attention with purity and verve.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Wiston Estate Winery 2015 Cuvée Brut Sparkling (England)

Description: Classy aromas of vanilla, toasted corn cake and dry yeast amount to a complex whole. A strong-boned palate brings the force as this brut nature tastes of chiseled citrus fruits backed by toast and yeast. A long, dry finish confirms the lean muscular focus this Cava brings to the table. Drink through 2025.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Mirgen Exeo Partage Qualificat Vallcirera Brut Nature
Name: Alta Alella 2015 Mirgen Exeo Partage Qualificat Vallcirera Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)

Description: This richly textured wine has gorgeous aromas of toast and fig that lead into flavors of just-ripe Pippin apple and Bosc pear on the palate. Partially barrel fermented, it has an enticing mouthfeel that's luxurious and complex.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Scotto Family Cellars NV Brut Sparkling (California)

Description: This richly textured wine has gorgeous aromas of toast and fig that lead into flavors of just-ripe Pippin apple and Bosc pear on the palate. Partially barrel fermented, it has an enticing mouthfeel that's luxurious and complex.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Scotto Family Cellars NV Brut Sparkling (California)

Description: Yeasty richness, reminiscent of rye crumb, blends with mellow notes of ripe Red Delicious apple on the appealing nose of this wine. Fresh and vivid, the palate adds creamy smoothness while the fine foam bubbles gently. There is both proper autolysis here and heightened freshness, creating an elegant and expressive wine with a long, yeasty aftertaste.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Emile Beyer NV Cuvée Emile Victor Brut Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

Description: Shortbread and fresh Amalfi lemon zest on the wine's nose make for a promising opening. On the palate, it is the pristine, bright and central shaft of lemon freshness that captures the attention. Everything—the still slightly frothy but calming foam, the gently yeasty backdrop, the slender but generous body—coalesces around this lemony core. This is for adults only but rather compelling.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Redfold Vineyards LLP NV Ambriel Classic Cuvée Brut Sparkling (England)

Description: In this wine, aromas of toasted brioche and smokiness rise from the glass. More air adds hints of beeswax and dried lemon rind, signaling evolution and complexity. The profound, yeasty texture comes with deliciously pithy walnut-skin bitterness, while supreme freshness pervades all. The foam is fine and creamy, the effect lasting and bone dry. Enjoy this complex and mature Crémant with food.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Philippe Sohler 2008 Millésimé Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

Description: Lime zest, ripe Mirabelle, earth, green apple, yeast and lemon all pop up on the vivid nose of this wine. The palate foams away with freshness, with smooth bubbles that enliven the light body. Pithy zestiness defines the dry, bright finish and makes you long for more.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: René Muré NV Brut Prestige Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

Description: Delicate aromas of yellow spring wildflower, white stone fruit and pastry dough float out of the glass. Creamy and delicious, the bright palate doles out ripe white peach, yellow apple, bread crust and baking spice alongside a silky mousse.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Gabriele Scaglione 2016 Metodo Classico Brut Sparkling (Alta Langa)

Description: The wine's nose unites pervasive freshness with mellow richness in its insistent green and tart red apple notions. Those same, opposing poles of utterly tart, bright freshness and creamy, mellow ripeness also combine on the palate, making this a most exciting proposition. Neither pole takes over, keeping that lovely tension all the way to the dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Hush Heath Estate 2016 Balfour Brut Rosé Sparkling (England)

Description: Subtle notes of dried lemon peel on this wine's nose hint at pithy depth. The bone-dry palate shows lovely concentration and exactly that citrus pithiness that was suggested on the nose. Fine, creamy bubbles add a sense of ease to this wine that is elegant, vivid and mouthwatering.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Bott-Geyl NV Paul-Edouard Extra Brut Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

Description: This wine has a shy nose, subtle and gentle. The mellow palate shows lovely signs of evolution. It conveys creamy complexity and a strong sense of soil and depth. A hint of chalkiness pairs with still-pervasive apple fruit and lemon freshness. The finish is dry, long and complex.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Charles Frey 2014 Quintessence Extra Brut Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

Description: Hints of green apple and lemon zest parade themselves with sprightly ease, assisted by the still frothy foam that's dancing and dazzling, bright and spiky one moment, creamy and mellow the next. A lovely, lively and nonetheless elegant sparkler of purity and freshness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Gusbourne Estate 2016 Brut Reserve Sparkling (England)

Description: A rich butterscotch color along with autolysis-based aromas of seashell, white mushroom, applesauce and brioche announce a smoothly layered palate. Salt notes are imparted to dried apricot and papaya flavors, while this mature vintage Xarello is controlled and tastes of salted nuts and flor on the finish. Drink through 2025.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Manuel Raventós Negra Conca del Riu Anoia
Name: Raventós I Blanc 2012 Manuel Raventós Negra Conca del Riu Anoia Sparkling (Penedès)

Description: Gentle creaminess is all that can be discerned on this wine's shy nose. The palate offers stone, yeast, chalk and citrus bedded in an autolytic backdrop with a lovely texture. Smooth, creamy foam enhances flavors. This elegant wine has a dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Charles Baur NV Brut Emotion Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

Description: A high tone of freshness is met with honeyed roundness on the nose of this wine, signaling evolution. The palate unfolds into vanilla-rounded creaminess, with a fine mousse. In this rich but bone-dry wine, the mellowness of oak is central. Fresh yet evolved, this is a complex sparkler for the table rather than aperitif. Unusual but very harmonious, the wine has a long finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Fernand Engel 2013 Trilogie Dosage Zero Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

Description: Golden Delicious apple, bruised apple skin and creaminess fill the nose on this wine, promising mellow richness. The palate provides a lush apple flavor and a lactic sense of creaminess. All is enlivened by frothy bubbles, pervading the dry palate with freshness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Marc Kreydenweiss 2017 Brut Nature Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

Description: Only the merest touch of citrus zest appears on the wine's nose, which does not want to give much away. The palate then adds a kind of powdery, buffered red apple fruit to the vivid, pervasive freshness. All about this is slender, taut, brisk and oh so fresh. The finish is dry and moreish with more of that citrus pithiness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Hush Heath Estate NV 1503 Classic Cuvée Brut Rosé Sparkling (England)

Description: Notions of wet chalk and fresh toast rises gently from the glass. The bone-dry palate of this wine homes in on the chalkiness and displays lovely, almost austere depth, rounded but fresh. This wine is understated and rather moreish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jean Becker 2017 B de Becker Extra Brut Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

Description: A lactic, milky freshness appears on the wine's nose first. With more air it gets creamier and morphs into a notion of buttery shortbread. The palate then majors on this shortbread theme, surrounding and enlivening it with lovely lemon freshness and adding a generous dosage that really lets the Golden Delicious apple notes speak. The mousse is admirably fine, and the finish is dry.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Vranken-Pommery Monopole NV Louis Pommery England Sparkling (England)

Description: Soft and supple, the nose of this wine suggests fresh green apple as well as riper, rounder yellow apple. The palate sweeps these up in vivid freshness made pliant by creamy autolysis and smooth foam. Balance, brightness and dryness make this wine captivating.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Charles Baur NV Brut Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

Description: Hints of green apple on this wine's nose are subtle but pure. The palate comes in with a richer aspect. It's creamy and resonant despite its inherent slenderness. The foam is gentle and smooth and the body is light, with fresh, bone-dry flavors.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Charles Frey 2018 Brut Nature Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

Description: A sense of Golden Delicious apple flesh is brightened by ripe lemon juiciness on the vivid nose of the wine. The palate adds a lovely note of buttery biscuit, providing a backdrop for the frothy foam and the lemony brightness, and enriching the slender palate. A lovely depth is hinted at, sure to show more of itself with some more bottle age, but for now this is a fruity, bright, dry, brisk joy.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Hattingley Valley Wines NV Classic Reserve Sparkling (England)

Description: Mellow, ripe Golden Delicious apple blends with subtle lemon as bubbles burst on the surface of this wine. The palate comes in with creaminess and a dry lemon freshness that underlines that apple mellowness. The wine has lovely balance, vivid freshness and proper texture.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Dopff & Irion NV Extra Brut Zero Dosage Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

Description: This light-bodied and well-balanced wine is elegant, flavorful and complex. It offers bright plum and raspberry notes, a creamy texture backed by some bracing acidity and a lingering finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Scotto Family Cellars NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (California)

Description: Toast, rye crumb and subtle notions of yellow apple and lemon are tentative on this wine's restrained nose but come to full flourish on the dry palate. The foam froths but is fine, and another year in bottle will make it even finer. Although toned and austere, the wine has something refreshing, too, with lovely depth.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Albert Mann 2017 Extra Brut Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

Description: Green apple, creaminess and dried white currant play on this wine's nose and come with a slight edge of honey. The palate intensifies that honeyed note while the body seems to dissolve into weightlessness with all that creamy mousse. It's an unusual sparkler with lovely depth and honeyed but dry individuality.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Frey-Sohler 2013 Emotion Brut Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

Description: Green apple, creaminess and dried white currant play on this wine's nose and come with a slight edge of honey. The palate intensifies that honeyed note while the body seems to dissolve into weightlessness with all that creamy mousse. It's an unusual sparkler with lovely depth and honeyed but dry individuality.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Frey-Sohler 2013 Emotion Brut Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

Description: A subtle note of all-butter shortbread is just hinted at on the wine's nose. It is on the creamy, rounded palate that the buttery, toasty smoothness becomes apparent, aligned beautifully with the vivid freshness. There is a lovely hint of Golden Delicious flesh on the smooth, dry finish, echoing long. Lovely.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Henners NV Brut Sparkling (England)

Description: Toast, rye crumb and subtle notions of yellow apple and lemon are tentative on this wine's restrained nose but come to full flourish on the dry palate. The foam froths but is fine, and another year in bottle will make it even finer. Although toned and austere, the wine has something refreshing, too, with lovely depth.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Albert Mann 2017 Extra Brut Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

Description: A gentle floral note plays about the pear and citrus on this wine's subtle nose. The palate unites smooth mellowness and a citric, spiky freshness, suggesting ripe, juicy Mirabelle plums. This wine has gentle depth, fine mousse and a bright personality.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: W. Gisselbrecht NV Brut Prestige Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

Description: Ripe, fresh apple beguiles right away with aromatic tartness and juiciness on this wine's appetizing nose. The palate is also imbued with vivid apple fruitiness and has lively, frothy foam. This wine will be even better with a little bottle age. The finish is balanced but bone dry.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Charles Frey 2018 Extra Brut Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

Description: Notes of lemon, red apple and strawberry combine on the nose of this wine. The palate likewise combines lemon freshness, apple texture and strawberry aroma. Fine foam accentuates the fruit and freshness makes everything lively. The body is slender and dry but full of fruit.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jean-Baptiste Adam NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)
